00176  *
00177  *  Description : ybos.c : contains support for the YBOS structure.
00178  *              : YBOS is a 4bytes aligned structure. The FIRST element
00179  *                of a YBOS event is always the LRL (Logical Record Length)
00180  *                This element represent the event size in 4 bytes count!
00181  *            
00182  *                The event structure is the following 
00183  *                        Midas event        Ybos event
00184  *         pheader ->     EVENT_HEADER      EVENT_HEADER      
00185  *         pmbkh   ->     BANK_HEADER           LRL             <- plrl
00186  *                        BANK              YBOS_BANK_HEADER    <- pybk
00187  *
00188  *                pevent is used for yb_any_....() pointing to pheader for MIDAS
00189  *                                                 pointing to plrl    for YBOS
00190  *                All ybk_...() requires plrl as input pointer
00191  *                All  bk_...() requires pmbkh as input pointer
00192  *
00193  *                While replaying data, the EVENT_HEADER has been striped out
00194  *                from the event in the YBOS format. In this case the plrl is the
00195  *                first data of the event. NO MORE EVENT_HEADER is present. In order
00196  *                to provide anyway some evnt info, The FE could produce a EVID bank
00197  *                containing a "copy" of the EVENT_HEADER (see ybos_simfe.c)
00198  *                If the EVID is present in the YBOS event, mdump will try to recover 
00199  *                this info and display it.
00200  *
00201  *                function marked with * are externaly accessible
00202  *
00203  *   Section a)*: bank manipulation.
00204  *                ybk_init
00205  *                ybk_create, ybk_create_chaos
00206  *                ybk_close, ybk_close_chaos
00207  *                ybk_size, ybk_list, ybk_find, ybk_locate, ybk_iterate
00208  *   Section b) : mlogger functions.
00209  *                *ybos_log_open,      *ybos_write,      *ybos_log_close
00210  *                ybos_log_dump,       ybos_buffer_flush 
00211  *                ybos_logfile_close,  ybos_logfile_open, 
00212  *   Section c)   utilities (mdump, lazylogger, etc...)
00213  *                *yb_any_file_ropen,   *yb_any_file_rclose (uses my struct)
00214  *                *yb_any_file_wopen    *yb_any_file_wclose
00215  *                *yb_any_physrec_get:   ybos_physrec_get
00216  *                                       midas_physrec_get
00217  *                yb_any_dev_os_read,  yb_any_dev_os_write
00218  *                *yb_any_log_write
00219  *                *yb_any_physrec_skip:  ybos_physrec_skip
00220  *                *yb_any_physrec_display
00221  *                *yb_any_all_info_display
00222  *                *yb_any_event_swap:    ybos_event_swap
00223  *                *yb_any_event_get:     ybos_event_get
00224  *                                       midas_event_get
00225  *                *yb_any_event_display: yb_any_raw_event_display
00226  *                                       yb_any_bank_event_display
00227  *                *yb_any_bank_display:  yb_any_raw_bank_display
00228  *                                       ybos_bank_display
00229  *                                       midas_bank_display
00230  *   Section d)   File fragmentation and recovery
00231  *                *feodb_file_dump:    yb_file_fragment
00232  *                *yb_file_recompose : yb_ymfile_open
00233  *                                     yb_ymfile_update
00234  *
00235  *                gz not tested
00236  *                ftp channel not tested
00237  *
00238 
00239  *          online replay MIDAS YBOS NT UNIX TAPE DISK FTP largeEVT frag/recomp
00240  *                
00241  */
00242

00279 INT yb_tid_size[] = {
00280    0,                           /* 0 not defined */
00281    2,                           /* 1 integer *2 */
00282    1,                           /* 2 ASCII bytes */
00283    4,                           /* 3 Integer *4 */
00284    4,                           /* 4 float *4 */
00285    8,                           /* 5 double */
00286    0,                           /* 6 undefined */
00287    0,                           /* 7 undefined */
00288    1,                           /* 8 logical*1 */
00289 };

00322 /* MAGTA parameters for YBOS disk file
00323    When the disk file has a *BOT record at the BOF then,
00324    VMS can read nicely the file. YBOS package knows how to
00325    deal with this too. The format in I*4 is then:
00326    0x00000004 (record length in bytes)
00327    0x544f422a (the record content "*BOT")
00328    0x7ff8 (record length in bytes)
00329    0x1ffd x 0x00000000 (empty record)
00330    0x7ff8 (record length in bytes)
00331    0x1ffd x user data
00332    0x7ff8 (record length in bytes)
00333    0x1ffd x user data
00334    :
00335    :
00336    */
00337 
00338 #ifdef INCLUDE_FTPLIB
00339 FTP_CON *ftp_con;
00340 #endif
00341 
00342 /* magta stuff */
00343 DWORD *pbot, *pbktop = NULL;
00344 char *ptopmrd;
00345 DWORD magta[3] = { 0x00000004, 0x544f422a, 0x00007ff8 };

00355 /* General YBOS/MIDAS struct for util */
00356 struct {
00357    INT handle;                  /* file handle */
00358    char name[MAX_FILE_PATH];    /* Device name (/dev/nrmt0h) */
00359 
00360    char *pmp;                   /* ptr to a physical TAPE_BUFFER_SIZE block */
00361    EVENT_HEADER *pmh;           /* ptr to Midas event (midas bank_header) */
00362    EVENT_HEADER *pme;           /* ptr to Midas content (event+1) (midas bank_header) */
00363    char *pmrd;                  /* current point in the phyical record */
00364 
00365    char *pmagta;                /* dummy zone for magta stuff */
00366    YBOS_PHYSREC_HEADER *pyh;    /* ptr to ybos physical block header */
00367    DWORD *pylrl;                /* ptr to ybos logical record */
00368    DWORD *pyrd;                 /* ptr to current loc in physical record */
00369 
00370    DWORD evtn;                  /* current event number */
00371    DWORD serial;                /* serial event number */
00372    DWORD evtlen;                /* current event length (-1 if not available) */
00373    DWORD size;                  /* ybos block size or midas max_evt_size */
00374    DWORD recn;                  /* ybos current physical record number */
00375    INT fmt;                     /* contains FORMAT type */
00376    INT type;                    /* Device type (tape, disk, ...) */
00377    DWORD runn;                  /* run number */
00378    BOOL zipfile;
00379    BOOL magtafl;
00380 } my;

00399 /********************************************************************/
00408 void ybk_init(DWORD * plrl)
00409 {
00410    *plrl = 0;
00411    return;
00412 }
00413 
00415 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS

00417 static YBOS_BANK_HEADER *__pbkh;
00418 
00420 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
00421 
00422 /********************************************************************/
00438 void ybk_create(DWORD * plrl, char *bkname, DWORD bktype, void *pbkdat)
00439 {
00440    DWORD dname = 0;
00441    __pbkh = (YBOS_BANK_HEADER *) (((DWORD *) (plrl + 1)) + (*(DWORD *) plrl));
00442    strncpy((char *) &dname, bkname, 4);
00443    __pbkh->name = *((DWORD *) bkname);
00444    __pbkh->number = 1;
00445    __pbkh->index = 0;
00446    __pbkh->length = 0;
00447    __pbkh->type = bktype;
00448    *((DWORD **) pbkdat) = (DWORD *) (__pbkh + 1);
00449    return;
00450 }
00451 
00453 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
00454 
00455 static DWORD *__pchaosi4;
00456 
00457 /********************************************************************/
00458 void ybk_create_chaos(DWORD * plrl, char *bkname, DWORD bktype, void *pbkdat)
00459 /********************************************************************\
00460 Routine: ybk_create
00461 Purpose: fills up the bank header,
00462 reserve the first 4bytes for the size of the bank in bt unit
00463 and return the pointer to the user space.
00464 Input:
00465 DWORD * pevt          pointer to the top of the YBOS event (LRL)
00466 char  * bname         Bank name should be char*4
00467 DWORD   bktype            Bank type can by either
00468 I2_BKTYPE, I1_BKTYPE, I4_BKTYPE, F4_BKTYPE
00469 Output:
00470 void    *pbkdat       pointer to first valid data of the created bank
00471 Function value:
00472 none
00473 \********************************************************************/
00474 {
00475    DWORD dname = 0;
00476    __pbkh = (YBOS_BANK_HEADER *) ((plrl + 1) + (*plrl));
00477    strncpy((char *) &dname, bkname, 4);
00478    __pbkh->name = *((DWORD *) bkname);
00479    __pbkh->number = 1;
00480    __pbkh->index = 0;
00481    __pbkh->length = 0;
00482    __pbkh->type = bktype;
00483 
00484    *((DWORD **) pbkdat) = (DWORD *) (__pbkh + 1);
00485    __pchaosi4 = (DWORD *) (*(DWORD *) pbkdat);
00486    *((DWORD **) pbkdat) += 1;
00487    return;
00488 }
00489 
00490 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00491 INT ybk_close_chaos(DWORD * plrl, DWORD bktype, void *pbkdat)
00492 /********************************************************************\
00493 Routine: ybk_close_chaos
00494 Purpose: patch the end of the event to the next 4 byte boundary,
00495 fills up the bank header,
00496 compute the data size in bt unit.
00497 update the LRL (pevt)
00498 Input:
00499 DWORD * pevt          pointer to the top of the YBOS event (LRL).
00500 DWORD   bt            bank type
00501 I2_BKTYPE, I1_BKTYPE, I4_BKTYPE, F4_BKTYPE
00502 void  * pbkdat        pointer to the user area
00503 Output:
00504 none
00505 Function value: Number of bytes in the bank.
00506 \********************************************************************/
00507 {
00508    switch (bktype) {
00509    case D8_BKTYPE:
00510       *__pchaosi4 = (DWORD) ((double *) pbkdat - (double *) __pchaosi4 - 1);
00511       break;
00512    case I4_BKTYPE:
00513    case F4_BKTYPE:
00514       *__pchaosi4 = (DWORD) ((DWORD *) pbkdat - __pchaosi4 - 1);
00515       break;
00516    case I2_BKTYPE:
00517       *__pchaosi4 = (DWORD) ((WORD *) pbkdat - (WORD *) __pchaosi4 - 2);
00518       SWAP_D2WORD(__pchaosi4);
00519       break;
00520    case I1_BKTYPE:
00521    case A1_BKTYPE:
00522       *__pchaosi4 = (DWORD) ((BYTE *) pbkdat - (BYTE *) __pchaosi4 - 4);
00523       break;
00524    default:
00525       printf(" unknown YBOS bank type (%ld)\n", bktype);
00526       break;
00527    }
00528 
00529    return ybk_close(plrl, pbkdat);
00530 }
00531 
00533 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
00534 
00535 /********************************************************************/
00549 INT ybk_close(DWORD * plrl, void *pbkdat)
00550 {
00551    DWORD tdlen;
00552    /* align pbkdat to I*4 */
00553    if (((DWORD) pbkdat & 0x1) != 0) {
00554       *((BYTE *) pbkdat) = 0x0f;
00555       pbkdat = (void *) (((BYTE *) pbkdat) + 1);
00556    }
00557    if (((DWORD) pbkdat & 0x2) != 0) {
00558       *((WORD *) pbkdat) = 0x0ffb;
00559       pbkdat = (void *) (((WORD *) pbkdat) + 1);
00560    }
00561 
00562    /* length in byte */
00563    tdlen = (DWORD) ((char *) pbkdat - (char *) __pbkh - sizeof(YBOS_BANK_HEADER));
00564 
00565    /* YBOS bank length in I4 */
00566    __pbkh->length = (tdlen + 4) / 4;    /* (+Bank Type &@#$!) YBOS bank length */
00567 
00568    /* adjust Logical Record Length (entry point from the system) */
00569    *plrl += __pbkh->length + (sizeof(YBOS_BANK_HEADER) / 4) - 1;
00570    return __pbkh->length;
00571 }
00572 
00573 /********************************************************************/
00579 INT ybk_size(DWORD * plrl)
00580 {
00581    return (*((DWORD *) plrl) * 4 + 4);
00582 }
00583 
00584 /********************************************************************/
00594 INT ybk_list(DWORD * plrl, char *bklist)
00595 {
00596 
00597    YBOS_BANK_HEADER *pbk;
00598    DWORD *pendevt, nbk;
00599 
00600    pbk = (YBOS_BANK_HEADER *) (plrl + 1);
00601 
00602    /* end of event pointer skip LRL, point to YBOS_BANK_HEADER */
00603    pendevt = (DWORD *) pbk + *plrl;
00604 
00605    /* check if bank_type in range */
00606    if (pbk->type >= MAX_BKTYPE)
00607       return (YB_WRONG_BANK_TYPE);
00608 
00609    /*init bank counter and returned string */
00610    nbk = 0;
00611    bklist[0] = 0;
00612 
00613    /* scan event */
00614    while ((DWORD *) pbk < pendevt) {
00615       /* update the number of bank counter */
00616       nbk++;
00617 
00618       if (nbk > YB_BANKLIST_MAX) {
00619          cm_msg(MINFO, "ybk_list", "over %i banks -> truncated", YB_BANKLIST_MAX);
00620          return (nbk);
00621       }
00622 
00623       /* append ybos bank name to list */
00624       strncat(bklist, (char *) &(pbk->name), 4);
00625 
00626       /* skip to next bank */
00627       pbk = (YBOS_BANK_HEADER *) (((DWORD *) pbk) + pbk->length + 4);
00628    }
00629    return (nbk);
00630 }
00631 
00632 /********************************************************************/
00643 INT ybk_find(DWORD * plrl, char *bkname, DWORD * bklen, DWORD * bktype, void **pbk)
00644 {
00645    YBOS_BANK_HEADER *pevt;
00646    DWORD *pendevt;
00647 
00648    pevt = (YBOS_BANK_HEADER *) (plrl + 1);
00649 
00650    /* end of event pointer skip LRL, point to YBOS_BANK_HEADER */
00651    pendevt = (DWORD *) pevt + *plrl;
00652 
00653    /* check if bank_type in range */
00654    if (pevt->type >= MAX_BKTYPE)
00655       return (YB_WRONG_BANK_TYPE);
00656 
00657    /* init returned variables */
00658    *bklen = 0;
00659    *bktype = 0;
00660 
00661    /* scan event */
00662    while ((DWORD *) pevt < pendevt) {
00663       /* check bank name */
00664       if (strncmp((char *) &(pevt->name), bkname, 4) == 0) {    /* bank name match */
00665          /* extract bank length */
00666          *bklen = pevt->length - 1;     /* exclude bank type */
00667 
00668          /* extract bank type */
00669          *bktype = pevt->type;
00670 
00671          /* return point to bank name */
00672          *pbk = &pevt->name;
00673          return (YB_SUCCESS);
00674       } else {
00675          /* skip to next bank */
00676          pevt = (YBOS_BANK_HEADER *) (((DWORD *) pevt) + pevt->length + 4);
00677       }
00678    }
00679    return (YB_BANK_NOT_FOUND);
00680 }
00681 
00682 /********************************************************************/
00690 INT ybk_locate(DWORD * plrl, char *bkname, void *pdata)
00691 {
00692    YBOS_BANK_HEADER *pybk;
00693    DWORD *pendevt;
00694 
00695    pybk = (YBOS_BANK_HEADER *) (plrl + 1);
00696 
00697    /* end of event pointer skip LRL, point to YBOS_BANK_HEADER */
00698    pendevt = (DWORD *) pybk + *plrl;
00699 
00700    /* check if bank_type in range */
00701    if (pybk->type >= MAX_BKTYPE)
00702       return (YB_WRONG_BANK_TYPE);
00703 
00704    /* scan event */
00705    while ((DWORD *) pybk < pendevt) {
00706       /* check bank name */
00707       if (strncmp((char *) &(pybk->name), bkname, 4) == 0) {    /* bank name match */
00708          /* extract bank length */
00709 
00710          /* return pointer to data section */
00711          *((void **) pdata) = pybk + 1;
00712          return (pybk->length - 1);
00713       } else {
00714          /* skip to next bank */
00715          pybk = (YBOS_BANK_HEADER *) (((DWORD *) pybk) + pybk->length + 4);
00716       }
00717    }
00718    return (YB_BANK_NOT_FOUND);
00719 }
00720 
00721 /********************************************************************/
00729 INT ybk_iterate(DWORD * plrl, YBOS_BANK_HEADER ** pybkh, void **pdata)
00730 {
00731    static int len;
00732    static DWORD *pendevt;
00733    static DWORD *pybk;
00734    /*PAA char bname[5]; */
00735 
00736    /* the event may have several bank
00737       check if we have been already in here */
00738    if (*pybkh == NULL) {
00739       /* first time in (skip lrl) */
00740       *pybkh = (YBOS_BANK_HEADER *) (plrl + 1);
00741 
00742       if ((*pybkh)->type > I1_BKTYPE) {
00743          *pdata = NULL;
00744          *pybkh = (YBOS_BANK_HEADER *) * pdata;
00745          return (YB_WRONG_BANK_TYPE);
00746       }
00747 
00748       /* end of event pointer (+ lrl) */
00749       pendevt = plrl + *plrl;
00750 
00751       /* skip the EVID bank if present */
00752     /*-PAA- keep it in for a little while Dec 17/98
00753     *((DWORD *)bname) = (*pybkh)->name;
00754     if (strncmp (bname,"EVID",4) == 0)
00755     {
00756     len = (*pybkh)->length;
00757     (YBOS_BANK_HEADER *)(*pybkh)++;
00758     pybk = (DWORD *) *pybkh;
00759     pybk += len - 1;
00760     *pybkh = (YBOS_BANK_HEADER *) pybk;
00761     }
00762     */
00763    } else {
00764       /* already been in iterate */
00765       /* skip current pointed bank ( + bank_length + header) */
00766       len = (*pybkh)->length;
00767       (YBOS_BANK_HEADER *) (*pybkh)++;
00768       pybk = (DWORD *) * pybkh;
00769       pybk += len - 1;
00770       *pybkh = (YBOS_BANK_HEADER *) pybk;
00771    }
00772 
00773    /* check for end of event */
00774    if ((DWORD *) (*pybkh) < pendevt) {
00775       /* points to the data section */
00776       *pdata = (void *) (*pybkh + 1);
00777 
00778       /* length always in I*4 due to YBOS -1 because type included in length !@# */
00779       return ((*pybkh)->length - 1);
00780    } else {
00781       /* no more bank in this event */
00782       *pdata = NULL;
00783       *pybkh = (YBOS_BANK_HEADER *) * pdata;
00784       return (-1);
00785    }
00786 }

00789 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
00790 
00791 /*-- GENERAL file fragmentation and recovery -----Section d)--------*/
00792 /*-- GENERAL file fragmentation and recovery -----------------------*/
00793 /*-- GENERAL file fragmentation and recovery -----------------------*/
00794 /*-- GENERAL file fragmentation and recovery -----------------------*/
00795 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00796 INT feodb_file_dump(EQUIPMENT * eqp, char *eqpname,
00797                     char *pevent, INT run_number, char *path)
00798 /********************************************************************\
00799 Routine: feodb_file_dump
00800 Purpose: Access ODB for the /Equipment/<equip_name>/Dump.
00801 in order to scan for file name and dump the files content to the
00802 Midas buffer channel.
00803 Input:
00804 EQUIPMENT * eqp           Current equipment
00805 INT       run_number      current run_number
00806 char      * path          full file name specification
00807 Output:
00808 none
00809 Function value:
00810 0                      Successful completion
00811 DB_INVALID_NAME        Equipment doesn't match request
00812 \********************************************************************/
00813 {
00814    EQUIPMENT *peqp;
00815    INT index, size, status;
00816    HNDLE hDB, hKey, hKeydump;
00817    char strpath[MAX_FILE_PATH], Dumpfile[MAX_FILE_PATH];
00818    char odb_entry[MAX_FILE_PATH];
00819    BOOL eqpfound = FALSE;
00820 
00821    cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &hKey);
00822    peqp = eqp;
00823 
00824    /* find the equipment info for this job */
00825    while (*(peqp->name) != 0) {
00826       if (equal_ustring((peqp->name), eqpname)) {
00827          eqpfound = TRUE;
00828          break;
00829       }
00830       peqp++;
00831    }
00832    if (!eqpfound)
00833       return DB_INVALID_NAME;
00834 
00835    /* loop over all channels */
00836    sprintf(odb_entry, "/Equipment/%s/Dump", path);
00837    status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, odb_entry, &hKey);
00838    if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
00839       cm_msg(MINFO, "ybos_odb_file_dump", "odb_access_file -I- %s not found", odb_entry);
00840       return YB_SUCCESS;
00841    }
00842    index = 0;
00843    while ((status = db_enum_key(hDB, hKey, index, &hKeydump)) != DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS) {
00844       if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
00845          size = sizeof(strpath);
00846          db_get_path(hDB, hKeydump, strpath, size);
00847          db_get_value(hDB, 0, strpath, Dumpfile, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
00848          yb_file_fragment(peqp, (EVENT_HEADER *) pevent, run_number, Dumpfile);
00849       }
00850       index++;
00851    }
00852    return (YB_SUCCESS);
00853 }
00854 
00855 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00856 INT yb_file_fragment(EQUIPMENT * eqp, EVENT_HEADER * pevent, INT run_number, char *path)
00857 /********************************************************************\
00858 Routine: yb_file_fragment
00859 Purpose: Fragment file in order to send it through Midas.
00860 Compose an event of the form of:
00861 Midas_header[(YM_CFILE)(YM_PFILE)(YM_DFILE)]
00862 Specific for the fe for either format YBOS/MIDAS
00863 Input:
00864 EQUIPMENT * eqp        Current equipment
00865 INT   run_number       currrent run_number
00866 char * path            full file name specification
00867 Output:
00868 none
00869 Function value:
00870 YB_SUCCESS          Successful completion
00871 SS_FILE_ERROR       file access error
00872 \********************************************************************/
00873 {
00874    INT dmpf, remaining;
00875    INT nread, filesize, nfrag;
00876    INT allheader_size;
00877    DWORD *pbuf, *pcfile, *pmy;
00878    YM_CFILE myc_fileh;
00879    YM_PFILE myp_fileh;
00880    int send_sock, flag;
00881 
00882    /* check if file exists */
00883    /* Open for read (will fail if file does not exist) */
00884    if ((dmpf = open(path, O_RDONLY | O_BINARY | O_LARGEFILE, 0644)) == -1) {
00885       cm_msg(MINFO, "ybos_file_fragment", "File dump -Failure- on open file %s", path);
00886       return SS_FILE_ERROR;
00887    }
00888 
00889    /* get file size */
00890    filestat = (struct stat *) malloc(sizeof(struct stat));
00891    stat(path, filestat);
00892    filesize = filestat->st_size;
00893    free(filestat);
00894    cm_msg(MINFO, "ybos_file_fragment", "Accessing File %s (%i)", path, filesize);
00895 
00896   /*-PAA-Oct06/97 added for ring buffer option */
00897    send_sock = rpc_get_send_sock();
00898 
00899    /* compute fragmentation & initialize */
00900    nfrag = filesize / MAX_FRAG_SIZE;
00901 
00902    /* Generate a unique FILE ID */
00903    srand((unsigned) time(NULL));
00904    srand((unsigned) time(NULL));
00905 
00906    /* Fill file YM_CFILE header */
00907    myc_fileh.file_ID = rand();
00908    myc_fileh.size = filesize;
00909    myc_fileh.total_fragment = nfrag + (((filesize % MAX_FRAG_SIZE) == 0) ? 0 : 1);
00910    myc_fileh.current_fragment = 0;
00911    myc_fileh.current_read_byte = 0;
00912    myc_fileh.run_number = run_number;
00913    myc_fileh.spare = 0x1234abcd;
00914 
00915    /* Fill file YM_PFILE header */
00916    memset(myp_fileh.path, 0, sizeof(YM_PFILE));
00917    /* first remove path if present */
00918    if (strrchr(path, '/') != NULL) {
00919       strncpy(myp_fileh.path, strrchr(path, '/') + 1, strlen(strrchr(path, '/')));
00920    } else
00921       strcpy(myp_fileh.path, path);
00922 
00923    /* allocate space */
00924    allheader_size = sizeof(EVENT_HEADER)
00925        + sizeof(YBOS_BANK_HEADER)       /* EVID bank header */
00926        +5 * sizeof(DWORD)       /* EVID data size */
00927        +sizeof(YM_CFILE)
00928        + sizeof(YM_PFILE) + 64;
00929 
00930    flag = 0;
00931    pevent -= 1;
00932 
00933    /* read file */
00934    while (myc_fileh.current_fragment <= nfrag) {
00935       /* pevent passed by fe for first event only */
00936       if (flag)
00937          pevent = dm_pointer_get();
00938       flag = 1;
00939 
00940       /* bank header */
00941       pmy = (DWORD *) (pevent + 1);
00942 
00943     /*-PAA-Oct06/97 for ring buffer reset the LRL */
00944       if (eqp->format == FORMAT_YBOS)
00945          ybk_init((DWORD *) pmy);
00946       else if (eqp->format == FORMAT_MIDAS)
00947          bk_init(pmy);
00948 
00949     /*---- EVID bank ----*/
00950       if (eqp->format == FORMAT_YBOS) {
00951          YBOS_EVID_BANK(pmy, myc_fileh.current_fragment,
00952                         (eqp->info.event_id << 16) | (eqp->info.trigger_mask)
00953                         , eqp->serial_number, run_number);
00954       } else if (eqp->format == FORMAT_MIDAS) {
00955          MIDAS_EVID_BANK(pmy, myc_fileh.current_fragment,
00956                          (eqp->info.event_id << 16) | (eqp->info.trigger_mask)
00957                          , eqp->serial_number, run_number);
00958       }
00959 
00960       /* Create Control file bank */
00961       if (eqp->format == FORMAT_YBOS)
00962          ybk_create(pmy, "CFIL", I4_BKTYPE, (DWORD *) & pbuf);
00963       else if (eqp->format == FORMAT_MIDAS)
00964          bk_create(pmy, "CFIL", TID_DWORD, &pbuf);
00965 
00966       /* save pointer for later */
00967       pcfile = pbuf;
00968       pbuf = (DWORD *) (((char *) pbuf) + sizeof(YM_CFILE));
00969       if (eqp->format == FORMAT_YBOS)
00970          ybk_close(pmy, pbuf);
00971       else if (eqp->format == FORMAT_MIDAS)
00972          bk_close(pmy, pbuf);
00973 
00974       /* Create Path file name bank */
00975       if (eqp->format == FORMAT_YBOS)
00976          ybk_create(pmy, "PFIL", A1_BKTYPE, (DWORD *) & pbuf);
00977       else if (eqp->format == FORMAT_MIDAS)
00978          bk_create(pmy, "PFIL", TID_CHAR, &pbuf);
00979       memcpy((char *) pbuf, (char *) &myp_fileh, sizeof(YM_PFILE));
00980       pbuf = (DWORD *) (((char *) pbuf) + sizeof(YM_CFILE));
00981       if (eqp->format == FORMAT_YBOS)
00982          ybk_close(pmy, pbuf);
00983       else if (eqp->format == FORMAT_MIDAS)
00984          bk_close(pmy, pbuf);
00985 
00986       /* file content */
00987       if (eqp->format == FORMAT_YBOS)
00988          ybk_create(pmy, "DFIL", A1_BKTYPE, (DWORD *) & pbuf);
00989       else if (eqp->format == FORMAT_MIDAS)
00990          bk_create(pmy, "DFIL", TID_CHAR, (DWORD *) & pbuf);
00991       /* compute data length */
00992       remaining = filesize - myc_fileh.current_read_byte;
00993       nread =
00994           read(dmpf, (char *) pbuf,
00995                (remaining > MAX_FRAG_SIZE) ? MAX_FRAG_SIZE : remaining);
00996       /* adjust target pointer */
00997       pbuf = (DWORD *) (((char *) pbuf) + nread);
00998       /* keep track of statistic */
00999       myc_fileh.current_fragment++;
01000       myc_fileh.fragment_size = nread;
01001       myc_fileh.current_read_byte += nread;
01002       memcpy((char *) pcfile, (char *) &myc_fileh, sizeof(YM_CFILE));
01003 
01004       /* close YBOS bank */
01005       if (eqp->format == FORMAT_YBOS)
01006          ybk_close(pmy, pbuf);
01007       else if (eqp->format == FORMAT_MIDAS)
01008          bk_close(pmy, pbuf);
01009 
01010       /* Fill the Midas header */
01011       if (eqp->format == FORMAT_YBOS)
01012          bm_compose_event(pevent, eqp->info.event_id,
01013                           eqp->info.trigger_mask, ybk_size(pmy), eqp->serial_number++);
01014       else if (eqp->format == FORMAT_MIDAS)
01015          bm_compose_event(pevent, eqp->info.event_id,
01016                           eqp->info.trigger_mask, bk_size(pmy), eqp->serial_number++);
01017 
01018     /*-PAA-Oct06/97 Added the ring buffer option for FE event send */
01019       eqp->bytes_sent += pevent->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER);
01020       eqp->events_sent++;
01021       if (eqp->buffer_handle) {
01022     /*-PAA- Jun98 These events should be sent directly as they come before the run
01023     started. If the event channel has to be used, then care should be taken
01024     if interrupt are being used too. May requires buffer checks like in
01025       scheduler (mfe.c) */
01026          /* #undef USE_EVENT_CHANNEL */
01027 #ifdef USE_EVENT_CHANNEL
01028          dm_pointer_increment(eqp->buffer_handle,
01029                               pevent->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER));
01030 #else
01031          rpc_flush_event();
01032          bm_send_event(eqp->buffer_handle, pevent,
01033                        pevent->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER), SYNC);
01034 #endif
01035          eqp->odb_out++;
01036       }
01037    }
01038    /* close file */
01039    if (close(dmpf)) {
01040       cm_msg(MERROR, "fe_file_dump", "cannot close file: %s", path);
01041       return SS_FILE_ERROR;
01042    }
01043    return YB_SUCCESS;
01044 }
01045 
01046 /* Used in mfe */
01047 INT ybos_get_tid_size(INT tid)
01048 {
01049    if (tid < 8)
01050       return yb_tid_size[tid];
01051    return 0;
01052 }

01054 /*
01055 The entrie section below will not be included in the VxWorks built of the
01056 libmidas.a library. All the functions are logger, mdump related and therefore
01057 certaintly of no use under this OS. 
01058 */
01059 #if !defined (OS_VXWORKS)       /* Frontend */
01060 /*---- LOGGER YBOS format routines ----Section b)--------------------------*/
01061 /*---- LOGGER YBOS format routines ----------------------------------------*/
01062 /*---- LOGGER YBOS format routines ----------------------------------------*/
01063 /*---- LOGGER YBOS format routines ----------------------------------------*/
01064 /*---- LOGGER YBOS format routines ----------------------------------------*/
01065 
01066 INT ybos_log_open(LOG_CHN * log_chn, INT run_number)
01067 /********************************************************************\
01068 Routine: ybos_log_open, Should be used only by mlogger.
01069 Purpose: Open a logger channel in YBOS fmt
01070 Input:
01071 LOG_CHN * log_chn      Concern log channel
01072 INT   run_number       run number
01073 Output:
01074 none
01075 Function value:
01076 error, success
01077 \********************************************************************/
01078 {
01079    YBOS_INFO *ybos;
01080    INT status;
01081 
01082    /* allocate YBOS buffer info */
01083    log_chn->format_info = (void **) malloc(sizeof(YBOS_INFO));
01084 
01085    ybos = (YBOS_INFO *) log_chn->format_info;
01086 
01087    /* reset memory */
01088    memset(ybos, 0, sizeof(YBOS_INFO));
01089 
01090    if (ybos == NULL) {
01091       log_chn->handle = 0;
01092       return SS_NO_MEMORY;
01093    }
01094 
01095    /* allocate full ring buffer for that channel */
01096    if ((ybos->ptop = (DWORD *) malloc(YBOS_BUFFER_SIZE)) == NULL) {
01097       log_chn->handle = 0;
01098       return SS_NO_MEMORY;
01099    }
01100 
01101    memset((char *) ybos->ptop, 0, YBOS_BUFFER_SIZE);
01102    /* Setup YBOS pointers */
01103    ybos->reco = YBOS_HEADER_LENGTH;
01104    ybos->pbuf = ybos->ptop + YBOS_HEADER_LENGTH;
01105    ybos->pwrt = ybos->pbuf;
01106    ybos->pbot = ybos->ptop + YBOS_PHYREC_SIZE;
01107    ybos->pend = ybos->ptop + YBOS_BUFFER_SIZE;
01108    ybos->recn = 0;
01109    /* open logging device */
01110    status = ybos_logfile_open(log_chn->type, log_chn->path, &log_chn->handle);
01111    if (status != SS_SUCCESS) {
01112       free(ybos->ptop);
01113       free(ybos);
01114       log_chn->handle = 0;
01115       return status;
01116    }
01117 
01118    /* write ODB dump */
01119    if (log_chn->settings.odb_dump)
01120       ybos_log_dump(log_chn, EVENTID_BOR, run_number);
01121 
01122    return SS_SUCCESS;
01123 }
01124 
01125 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01126 INT ybos_logfile_open(INT type, char *path, HNDLE * handle)
01127 /********************************************************************\
01128 Routine: ybos_logfile_open
01129 Purpose: Open a YBOS logging channel for either type (Disk/Tape)
01130 The device open is taken care here. But the writting is done
01131 through yb_any_dev_os_write for ybos magta.
01132 
01133 Input:
01134 INT type       : Disk, Tape
01135 char * path    : Device name
01136 
01137 Output:
01138 HNDLE * handle ; returned handle of the open device
01139 none
01140 Function value:
01141 error, success
01142 \********************************************************************/
01143 {
01144 #ifdef YBOS_VERSION_3_3
01145    INT status;
01146    DWORD written;
01147 #endif
01148 
01149    /* Create device channel */
01150    if (type == LOG_TYPE_TAPE) {
01151     /*-PAA- Should check for the TAPE_BUFFER_SIZE set in ss_tape_open() */
01152       return ss_tape_open(path, O_WRONLY | O_CREAT | O_TRUNC, handle);
01153    } else if (type == LOG_TYPE_DISK) {
01154 #ifdef OS_WINNT
01155       *handle =
01156           (int) CreateFile(path, GENERIC_WRITE, FILE_SHARE_READ, NULL,
01157                            CREATE_ALWAYS,
01158                            FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NORMAL | FILE_FLAG_WRITE_THROUGH
01159                            | FILE_FLAG_SEQUENTIAL_SCAN, 0);
01160 #else
01161       *handle = open(path, O_WRONLY | O_CREAT | O_TRUNC | O_BINARY | O_LARGEFILE, 0644);
01162 #endif
01163       if (*handle < 0)
01164          return SS_FILE_ERROR;
01165 #ifdef YBOS_VERSION_3_3
01166       /* specific to YBOS Disk structure */
01167       /* write MAGTA header in bytes 0x4, "*BOT" */
01168       status = yb_any_dev_os_write(*handle, type, (char *) magta, 8, &written);
01169       if (status != SS_SUCCESS)
01170          return status;
01171 
01172       /* allocate temporary emtpy record */
01173       pbot = realloc(pbot, magta[2] - 4);
01174       memset((char *) pbot, 0, magta[2] - 4);
01175       /* write BOT empty record for MAGTA */
01176       status = yb_any_dev_os_write(*handle, type, (char *) pbot, magta[2] - 4, &written);
01177       if (status != SS_SUCCESS)
01178          return status;
01179 #endif
01180    }
01181    return YB_SUCCESS;
01182 }
01183 
01184 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01185 INT ybos_write(LOG_CHN * log_chn, EVENT_HEADER * pevent, INT evt_size)
01186 /********************************************************************\
01187 Routine: ybos_write
01188 Purpose: Write a YBOS event to the logger channel. Should be used only by 
01189 mlogger.
01190 Takes care of the EVENT_BOR and EVENT_MESSAGE which are 
01191 shiped as YBOS bank in A1_BKTYPE bank. named respectively
01192 MODB, MMSG
01193 Input:
01194 LOG_CHN *      log_chn      Concern log channel
01195 EVENT_HEADER * pevent       event pointer to Midas header
01196 INT            evt_size     event size in bytes seen by Midas
01197 Output:
01198 none
01199 Function value:
01200 error, success
01201 \********************************************************************/
01202 {
01203    short int evid, evmsk;
01204    BOOL large_evt;
01205    INT status, left_over_length, datasize;
01206    YBOS_INFO *ybos;
01207    DWORD *pbkdat;
01208    DWORD bfsize;
01209    YBOS_PHYSREC_HEADER *yb_phrh;
01210 
01211    /* Check the Event ID for :
01212       Midas BOR/EOR which include the ODB dump : 0x8000/0x8001
01213       Msg dump from MUSER flag from odb mainly : 0x8002
01214     */
01215 
01216    evid = pevent->event_id;
01217    evmsk = pevent->trigger_mask;
01218 
01219    /* shortcut to ybos struct */
01220    ybos = (YBOS_INFO *) log_chn->format_info;
01221 
01222    /* detect if event is message oriented (ASCII) */
01223    if ((evid >= EVENTID_BOR) && (evid <= EVENTID_MESSAGE)) {    /* skip ASCII dump if not MUSER */
01224       if (!(evmsk & MT_USER))
01225          return SS_SUCCESS;
01226 
01227       /* skip if MUSER  but not Log message enabled */
01228       if (MT_USER && !log_chn->settings.log_messages)
01229          return SS_SUCCESS;
01230 
01231       /* ASCII event has to be recasted YBOS */
01232       /* Inform if event too long (>32Kbytes) */
01233       if (pevent->data_size > MAX_EVENT_SIZE)
01234          cm_msg(MINFO, "ybos_write", "MMSG or MODB event too large");
01235 
01236       /* align to DWORD boundary in bytes */
01237       datasize = 4 * (pevent->data_size + 3) / 4;
01238 
01239       /* overall buffer size in bytes */
01240       bfsize = datasize + sizeof(YBOS_BANK_HEADER) + 4; /* +LRL */
01241 
01242       /* allocate space */
01243       pbktop = (DWORD *) malloc(bfsize);
01244       if (pbktop == NULL) {
01245          cm_msg(MERROR, "ybos_write", "malloc error for ASCII dump");
01246          return SS_NO_MEMORY;
01247       }
01248       memset(pbktop, 0, bfsize);
01249       ybk_init(pbktop);
01250 
01251       /* open bank depending on event type */
01252       if (evid == EVENTID_MESSAGE)
01253          ybk_create(pbktop, "MMSG", A1_BKTYPE, &pbkdat);
01254       else
01255          ybk_create(pbktop, "MODB", A1_BKTYPE, &pbkdat);
01256 
01257       memcpy((char *) pbkdat, (char *) (pevent + 1), pevent->data_size);
01258       pbkdat = (DWORD *) (((char *) pbkdat) + datasize);
01259       ybk_close(pbktop, pbkdat);
01260 
01261       /* event size in bytes for Midas */
01262       evt_size = ybk_size(pbktop);
01263 
01264       /* swap bytes if necessary based on the ybos.bank_type */
01265       ybos_event_swap((DWORD *) pbktop);
01266 
01267       /* Event with MIDAS header striped out */
01268       memcpy((char *) ybos->pbuf, (char *) pbktop, evt_size);
01269 
01270       if (pbktop != NULL)
01271          free(pbktop);
01272       pbktop = NULL;
01273       status = SS_SUCCESS;
01274    } else {                     /* normal event */
01275       /* Strip the event from the Midas EVENT_HEADER */
01276       /* event size include the Midas EVENT_HEADER... don't need for ybos
01277          I do this in order to keep the log_write from mlogger intact */
01278 
01279       /* correct the event length. Now it is a pure YBOS event */
01280       pevent++;
01281 
01282       /* correct the event length in bytes */
01283       evt_size -= sizeof(EVENT_HEADER);
01284 
01285       /* swap bytes if necessary based on the ybos.bank_type */
01286       ybos_event_swap((DWORD *) pevent);
01287 
01288       /* I have ALWAYS enough space for the event <MAX_EVENT_SIZE */
01289       memcpy((char *) ybos->pbuf, (char *) pevent, evt_size);
01290 
01291       status = YB_SUCCESS;
01292    }
01293 
01294    /* move write pointer to next free location (DWORD) */
01295    ybos->pbuf += (4 * (evt_size + 3) / 4) >> 2;
01296 
01297    /* default not a large event */
01298    large_evt = FALSE;
01299 
01300    /* Loop over buffer until this condition 
01301       The event offset in the phys rec is ==0 if event larger than PHYREC_SIZE */
01302    while (ybos->pbuf >= ybos->pbot) {
01303       ybos->pwrt -= YBOS_HEADER_LENGTH;
01304       yb_phrh = (YBOS_PHYSREC_HEADER *) (ybos->pwrt);
01305       yb_phrh->rec_size = YBOS_PHYREC_SIZE - 1; /* exclusive */
01306       yb_phrh->header_length = YBOS_HEADER_LENGTH;
01307       yb_phrh->rec_num = ybos->recn;
01308       yb_phrh->offset = large_evt ? 0 : ybos->reco;
01309 
01310       /* Write physical record to device */
01311       status =
01312           yb_any_log_write(log_chn->handle, log_chn->format, log_chn->type,
01313                            ybos->pwrt, YBOS_PHYREC_SIZE << 2);
01314       if (status != SS_SUCCESS)
01315          return status;
01316 
01317       /* update statistics */
01318 #ifdef YBOS_VERSION_3_3
01319       if (log_chn->type == LOG_TYPE_TAPE) {     /* statistics in bytes */
01320          log_chn->statistics.bytes_written += YBOS_PHYREC_SIZE << 2;
01321          log_chn->statistics.bytes_written_total += YBOS_PHYREC_SIZE << 2;
01322       } else {                  /* statistics in bytes + the extra magta */
01323          log_chn->statistics.bytes_written += YBOS_PHYREC_SIZE << 2 + 4;
01324          log_chn->statistics.bytes_written_total += YBOS_PHYREC_SIZE << 2 + 4;
01325       }
01326 #else
01327       log_chn->statistics.bytes_written += YBOS_PHYREC_SIZE << 2;
01328       log_chn->statistics.bytes_written_total += YBOS_PHYREC_SIZE << 2;
01329 #endif
01330 
01331       /* Update statistics */
01332       ybos->recn++;
01333 
01334       /* check if event is larger than YBOS_PHYREC_SIZE */
01335       if (ybos->pbuf >= ybos->pbot + (YBOS_PHYREC_SIZE - YBOS_HEADER_LENGTH)) {
01336          large_evt = TRUE;
01337          /* shift record window by one YBOS_PHYSREC - header */
01338          ybos->pwrt = ybos->pbot;
01339          ybos->pbot += (YBOS_PHYREC_SIZE - YBOS_HEADER_LENGTH);
01340       } else {
01341          large_evt = FALSE;
01342          /* adjust pointers */
01343          ybos->pwrt = ybos->ptop + YBOS_HEADER_LENGTH;
01344          left_over_length = ybos->pbuf - ybos->pbot;
01345          memcpy(ybos->pwrt, ybos->pbot, left_over_length << 2); /* in bytes */
01346          ybos->pbuf = ybos->pwrt + left_over_length;
01347          ybos->pbot = ybos->ptop + YBOS_PHYREC_SIZE;
01348          ybos->reco = ybos->pbuf - ybos->pwrt + 4;      /* YBOS header */
01349       }
01350    }
01351 
01352    /* update statistics */
01353    log_chn->statistics.events_written++;
01354 
01355    return status;
01356 }
01357 
01358 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01359 INT ybos_buffer_flush(LOG_CHN * log_chn, INT run_number)
01360 /********************************************************************\
01361 Routine: ybos_buffer_flush
01362 Purpose: Empty the internal buffer to logger channel for YBOS fmt
01363 YBOS end of run marks (End of file) is -1 in the *plrl
01364 I'm writting an extra FULL YBOS_PHYSREC_SIZE of -1
01365 Input:
01366 LOG_CHN * log_chn      Concern log channel
01367 Output:
01368 none
01369 Function value:
01370 error, success
01371 \********************************************************************/
01372 {
01373    INT status;
01374    YBOS_INFO *ybos;
01375    YBOS_PHYSREC_HEADER *yb_phrh;
01376 
01377    ybos = (YBOS_INFO *) log_chn->format_info;
01378 
01379    /* dump the ODB if necessary */
01380    if (log_chn->settings.odb_dump)
01381       ybos_log_dump(log_chn, EVENTID_EOR, run_number);
01382 
01383    /* adjust read pointer to beg of record */
01384    ybos->pwrt -= YBOS_HEADER_LENGTH;
01385    yb_phrh = (YBOS_PHYSREC_HEADER *) ybos->pwrt;
01386 
01387    yb_phrh->rec_size = YBOS_PHYREC_SIZE - 1;    /* exclusive */
01388    yb_phrh->header_length = YBOS_HEADER_LENGTH; /* inclusive */
01389    yb_phrh->rec_num = ybos->recn;
01390    yb_phrh->offset = ybos->reco;        /* exclusive from block_size */
01391 
01392 /* YBOS known only about fix record size. The way to find out
01393 it there is no more valid event is to look at the LRL for -1
01394   put some extra -1 in the current physical record */
01395    memset((DWORD *) ybos->pbuf, -1, YBOS_PHYREC_SIZE << 2);
01396 
01397    /* write record to device */
01398    status =
01399        yb_any_log_write(log_chn->handle, log_chn->format, log_chn->type,
01400                         ybos->pwrt, YBOS_PHYREC_SIZE << 2);
01401 #ifdef YBOS_VERSION_3_3
01402    if (log_chn->type == LOG_TYPE_TAPE) {
01403       log_chn->statistics.bytes_written += YBOS_PHYREC_SIZE << 2;
01404       log_chn->statistics.bytes_written_total += YBOS_PHYREC_SIZE << 2;
01405    } else {
01406       /* write MAGTA header (4bytes)=0x7ff8 */
01407       log_chn->statistics.bytes_written += YBOS_PHYREC_SIZE << 2 + 4;
01408       log_chn->statistics.bytes_written_total += YBOS_PHYREC_SIZE << 2 + 4;
01409    }
01410 #else
01411    log_chn->statistics.bytes_written += YBOS_PHYREC_SIZE << 2;
01412    log_chn->statistics.bytes_written_total += YBOS_PHYREC_SIZE << 2;
01413 #endif
01414    return status;
01415 }
01416 
01417 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01418 INT ybos_logfile_close(INT type, HNDLE handle)
01419 /********************************************************************\
01420 Routine: ybos_logfile_close
01421 Purpose: close a logging channel for either type (Disk/Tape)
01422 For the tape I'm writting just a EOF and expect the rewind command to 
01423 write another one if necessary. This way the run restart is faster.
01424 Input:
01425 INT type       : Disk, Tape
01426 HNDLE * handle ; returned handle of the open device
01427 
01428 Output:
01429 none
01430 Function value:
01431 error, success
01432 \********************************************************************/
01433 {
01434    INT status;
01435    /* Write EOF if Tape */
01436    if (type == LOG_TYPE_TAPE) {
01437       /* writing EOF mark on tape only */
01438       status = ss_tape_write_eof(handle);
01439 #ifdef OS_UNIX
01440       if (status != SS_SUCCESS) {
01441          if (errno == EIO)
01442             return SS_IO_ERROR;
01443          if (errno == ENOSPC)
01444             return SS_NO_SPACE;
01445          else
01446             return status;
01447       }
01448 #endif
01449 #ifdef OS_WINNT
01450       if (status != SS_SUCCESS) {
01451          if (errno == ERROR_END_OF_MEDIA)
01452             return SS_NO_SPACE;
01453          else
01454             return status;
01455       }
01456 #endif
01457 
01458       ss_tape_close(handle);
01459    } else if (type == LOG_TYPE_DISK) {
01460 #ifdef OS_WINNT
01461       CloseHandle((HANDLE) handle);
01462 #else
01463       close(handle);
01464 #endif
01465    }
01466    return YB_SUCCESS;
01467 }
01468 
01469 
01470 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01471 INT ybos_log_close(LOG_CHN * log_chn, INT run_number)
01472 /********************************************************************\
01473 Routine: ybos_log_close
01474 Purpose: Close a YBOS logger channel, Should be used only by mlogger.
01475 Input:
01476 LOG_CHN * log_chn      Concern log channel
01477 INT   run_number       run number
01478 Output:
01479 none
01480 Function value:
01481 error, success
01482 \********************************************************************/
01483 {
01484    INT status;
01485    YBOS_INFO *ybos;
01486 
01487    ybos = (YBOS_INFO *) log_chn->format_info;
01488 
01489    /* Write EOF mark and close the device */
01490    /* flush buffer before closing */
01491    status = ybos_buffer_flush(log_chn, run_number);
01492 
01493    if (status != SS_SUCCESS)
01494       return status;
01495 
01496    status = ybos_logfile_close(log_chn->type, log_chn->handle);
01497 
01498    free(ybos->ptop);
01499    free(ybos);
01500 
01501    return SS_SUCCESS;
01502 }
01503 
01504 /*---- ODB   manipulation   ----------------------------------------*/
01505 void ybos_log_dump(LOG_CHN * log_chn, short int event_id, INT run_number)
01506 /********************************************************************\
01507 Routine: ybos_log_dump, used by mlogger, ybos_log_open
01508 Purpose: Serves the logger flag /logger/settings/ODB dump
01509 Extract the ODB in ASCII format and send it to the logger channel
01510 Compose a ybos bank in A1_BKTYPE regardless of the odb size.
01511 It uses ybos_write to compose the actual event. From here it looks
01512 like a MIDAS event.
01513 Input:
01514 LOG_CHN * log_chn      Concern log channel
01515 short in  event_id     event ID
01516 INT   run_number       run number
01517 Output:
01518 none
01519 Function value:
01520 none
01521 \********************************************************************/
01522 {
01523    INT status, buffer_size, size;
01524    EVENT_HEADER *pevent;
01525    HNDLE hDB;
01526 
01527    cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, NULL);
01528    /* write ODB dump */
01529    buffer_size = 10000;
01530    do {
01531       pevent = (EVENT_HEADER *) malloc(buffer_size);
01532       if (pevent == NULL) {
01533          cm_msg(MERROR, "ybos_odb_log_dump", "Cannot allocate ODB dump buffer");
01534          break;
01535       }
01536 
01537       size = buffer_size - sizeof(EVENT_HEADER);
01538       status = db_copy(hDB, 0, (char *) (pevent + 1), &size, "");
01539       if (status != DB_TRUNCATED) {
01540          bm_compose_event(pevent, event_id, MIDAS_MAGIC,
01541                           buffer_size - sizeof(EVENT_HEADER) - size + 1, run_number);
01542          ybos_write(log_chn, pevent, pevent->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER));
01543          break;
01544       }
01545 
01546       /* increase buffer size if truncated */
01547       free(pevent);
01548       buffer_size *= 2;
01549    } while (1);
01550    free(pevent);
01551 }
01552 
01553 /*-- GENERAL mdump functions for MIDAS / YBOS -----Section c)-------*/
01554 /*-- GENERAL mdump functions for MIDAS / YBOS ----------------------*/
01555 /*-- GENERAL mdump functions for MIDAS / YBOS ----------------------*/
01556 /*-- GENERAL mdump functions for MIDAS / YBOS ----------------------*/
01557 /*-- GENERAL mdump functions for MIDAS / YBOS ----------------------*/
01558 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01559 INT yb_any_file_ropen(char *infile, INT data_fmt)
01560 /********************************************************************\
01561 Routine: external yb_any_file_ropen
01562 Purpose: Open data file for replay for the given data format.
01563 It uses the local "my" structure.
01564 Input:
01565 INT data_fmt :  YBOS or MIDAS 
01566 char * infile : Data file name
01567 Output:
01568 none
01569 Function value:
01570 status : from lower function
01571 \********************************************************************/
01572 {
01573    INT status;
01574 
01575    /* fill up record with file name */
01576    strcpy(my.name, infile);
01577 
01578    /* find out what dev it is ? : check on /dev */
01579    my.zipfile = FALSE;
01580    if ((strncmp(my.name, "/dev", 4) == 0) || (strncmp(my.name, "\\\\.\\", 4) == 0)) {
01581       /* tape device */
01582       my.type = LOG_TYPE_TAPE;
01583    } else {
01584       /* disk device */
01585       my.type = LOG_TYPE_DISK;
01586       if (strncmp(infile + strlen(infile) - 3, ".gz", 3) == 0)
01587          my.zipfile = TRUE;
01588    }
01589 
01590    /* open file */
01591    if (!my.zipfile) {
01592       if (my.type == LOG_TYPE_TAPE) {
01593          status = ss_tape_open(my.name, O_RDONLY | O_BINARY, &my.handle);
01594       }
01595       else if ((my.handle = open(my.name, O_RDONLY | O_BINARY | O_LARGEFILE, 0644)) == -1)
01596       {
01597          printf("dev name :%s Handle:%d \n", my.name, my.handle);
01598          return (SS_FILE_ERROR);
01599       }
01600    } else {
01601 #ifdef INCLUDE_ZLIB
01602       if (my.type == LOG_TYPE_TAPE) {
01603          printf(" Zip on tape not yet supported \n");
01604          return (SS_FILE_ERROR);
01605       }
01606       filegz = gzopen(my.name, "rb");
01607       my.handle = 0;
01608       if (filegz == NULL) {
01609          printf("dev name :%s gzopen error:%d \n", my.name, my.handle);
01610          return (SS_FILE_ERROR);
01611       }
01612 #else
01613       cm_msg(MERROR, "ybos.c", "Zlib not included ... gz file not supported");
01614       return (SS_FILE_ERROR);
01615 #endif
01616    }
01617 
01618    if (data_fmt == FORMAT_YBOS) {
01619       my.fmt = FORMAT_YBOS;
01620       my.size = YBOS_PHYREC_SIZE;       /* in DWORD  */
01621       my.pmagta = (char *) malloc(32);
01622       if (my.pmagta == NULL)
01623          return SS_NO_MEMORY;
01624       my.pyh = (YBOS_PHYSREC_HEADER *) malloc(my.size * 14);
01625       if (my.pyh == NULL)
01626          return SS_NO_MEMORY;
01627       (my.pyh)->rec_size = my.size - 1;
01628       (my.pyh)->header_length = YBOS_HEADER_LENGTH;
01629       (my.pyh)->rec_num = 0;
01630       (my.pyh)->offset = 0;
01631       /* current ptr in the physical record */
01632       my.pyrd = (DWORD *) ((DWORD *) my.pyh + (my.pyh)->offset);
01633 
01634       /* allocate memory for one full event */
01635       my.pylrl = (DWORD *) malloc(MAX_EVENT_SIZE);      /* in bytes */
01636       if (my.pylrl == NULL)
01637          return SS_NO_MEMORY;
01638       memset((char *) my.pylrl, -1, MAX_EVENT_SIZE);
01639 
01640       /* reset first path */
01641       my.magtafl = FALSE;
01642    } else if (data_fmt == FORMAT_MIDAS) {
01643       my.fmt = FORMAT_MIDAS;
01644       my.size = TAPE_BUFFER_SIZE;
01645       my.pmp = (char *) malloc(my.size);
01646       if (my.pmp == NULL)
01647          return SS_NO_MEMORY;
01648       my.pme = (EVENT_HEADER *) my.pmp;
01649 
01650       /* allocate memory for one full event */
01651       if (my.pmrd != NULL)
01652          free(my.pmrd);
01653       my.pmrd = (char *) malloc(5 * MAX_EVENT_SIZE);    /* in bytes */
01654       ptopmrd = my.pmrd;
01655       if (my.pmrd == NULL)
01656          return SS_NO_MEMORY;
01657       memset((char *) my.pmrd, -1, 5 * MAX_EVENT_SIZE);
01658       my.pmh = (EVENT_HEADER *) my.pmrd;
01659    }
01660 
01661    /* initialize pertinent variables */
01662    my.recn = (DWORD) - 1;       /* physical record number */
01663    my.evtn = 0;
01664    return (YB_SUCCESS);
01665 }
01666 
01667 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01668 INT yb_any_file_rclose(INT data_fmt)
01669 /********************************************************************
01670 Routine: external yb_any_file_rclose
01671 Purpose: Close a data file used for replay for the given data format
01672 Input:
01673 INT data_fmt :  YBOS or MIDAS 
01674 Output:
01675 none
01676 Function value:
01677 status : from lower function
01678 *******************************************************************/
01679 {
01680    switch (my.type) {
01681    case LOG_TYPE_TAPE:
01682    case LOG_TYPE_DISK:
01683       /* close file */
01684       if (my.zipfile) {
01685 #ifdef INCLUDE_ZLIB
01686          gzclose(filegz);
01687 #endif
01688       } else {
01689          if (my.handle != 0)
01690             close(my.handle);
01691       }
01692       break;
01693    }
01694    if (my.pmagta != NULL)
01695       free(my.pmagta);
01696    if (my.pyh != NULL)
01697       free(my.pyh);
01698    if (my.pylrl != NULL)
01699       free(my.pylrl);
01700    if (my.pmrd != NULL)
01701       free(my.pmrd);
01702    if (my.pmp != NULL)
01703       free(my.pmp);
01704    my.pylrl = NULL;
01705    my.pyh = NULL;
01706    my.pmagta = NULL;
01707    my.pmp = NULL;
01708    my.pmh = NULL;
01709    my.pmrd = NULL;
01710    return (YB_SUCCESS);
01711 }
01712 
01713 #ifdef INCLUDE_FTPLIB
01714 
01715 /* @ NOT TESTED @ */
01716 INT yb_ftp_open(char *destination, FTP_CON ** con)
01717 {
01718    INT status;
01719    short port = 0;
01720    char *token, host_name[HOST_NAME_LENGTH],
01721        user[32], pass[32], directory[256], file_name[256], file_mode[256];
01722 
01723    /* 
01724       destination should have the form:
01725       host, port, user, password, directory, run%05d.mid
01726     */
01727 
01728    /* break destination in components */
01729    token = strtok(destination, ",");
01730    if (token)
01731       strcpy(host_name, token);
01732 
01733    token = strtok(NULL, ", ");
01734    if (token)
01735       port = atoi(token);
01736 
01737    token = strtok(NULL, ", ");
01738    if (token)
01739       strcpy(user, token);
01740 
01741    token = strtok(NULL, ", ");
01742    if (token)
01743       strcpy(pass, token);
01744 
01745    token = strtok(NULL, ", ");
01746    if (token)
01747       strcpy(directory, token);
01748 
01749    token = strtok(NULL, ", ");
01750    if (token)
01751       strcpy(file_name, token);
01752 
01753    token = strtok(NULL, ", ");
01754    file_mode[0] = 0;
01755    if (token)
01756       strcpy(file_mode, token);
01757 
01758    status = ftp_login(con, host_name, port, user, pass, "");
01759    if (status >= 0)
01760       return status;
01761 
01762    status = ftp_chdir(*con, directory);
01763    if (status >= 0)
01764       return status;
01765 
01766    status = ftp_binary(*con);
01767    if (status >= 0)
01768       return status;
01769 
01770    if (file_mode[0]) {
01771       status = ftp_command(*con, "umask %s", file_mode, 200, 250, EOF);
01772 /*  command is not supported everywhere
01773        if (status >= 0)
01774          return status;
01775 */
01776    }
01777 
01778    printf("openning remote file [%s] in write mode...\n",file_name);
01779    if (ftp_open_write(*con, file_name) >= 0)
01780       return (*con)->err_no;
01781 
01782    return SS_SUCCESS;
01783 }
01784 
01785 /* @ NOT TESTED @ */
01786 #endif
01787 
01788 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01789 INT yb_any_file_wopen(INT type, INT data_fmt, char *filename, INT * hDev)
01790 /********************************************************************
01791 Routine: external yb_any_file_wopen
01792 Purpose: Open a data file for the given data format
01793 Input:
01794 INT type     :  Tape or Disk
01795 INT data_fmt :  YBOS or MIDAS
01796 char * filename : file to open
01797 Output:
01798 INT * hDev      : file handle
01799 Function value:
01800 status : from lower function
01801 *******************************************************************/
01802 {
01803    INT status = 0;
01804 
01805    if (type == LOG_TYPE_DISK)
01806       /* takes care of TapeLX/NT under ss_tape_open , DiskLX/NT here */
01807    {
01808       if (data_fmt == FORMAT_YBOS) {
01809          /* takes care of TapeLX/NT under ss_tape_open , DiskLX/NT there */
01810          status = ybos_logfile_open(type, filename, hDev);
01811       } else if (data_fmt == FORMAT_MIDAS) {
01812 #ifdef OS_WINNT
01813          *hDev =
01814              (int) CreateFile(filename, GENERIC_WRITE, FILE_SHARE_READ,
01815                               NULL, CREATE_ALWAYS,
01816                               FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NORMAL |
01817                               FILE_FLAG_WRITE_THROUGH | FILE_FLAG_SEQUENTIAL_SCAN, 0);
01818 #else
01819          *hDev = open(filename, O_WRONLY | O_CREAT | O_TRUNC | O_BINARY | O_LARGEFILE, 0644);
01820 #endif
01821          status = *hDev < 0 ? SS_FILE_ERROR : SS_SUCCESS;
01822       }
01823    } else if (type == LOG_TYPE_TAPE) {
01824       if (data_fmt == FORMAT_YBOS) {
01825          /* takes care of TapeLX/NT under ss_tape_open , DiskLX/NT there */
01826          status = ybos_logfile_open(type, filename, hDev);
01827       } else if (data_fmt == FORMAT_MIDAS)
01828          status = ss_tape_open(filename, O_WRONLY | O_CREAT | O_TRUNC, hDev);
01829    } else if (type == LOG_TYPE_FTP) {
01830 #ifdef INCLUDE_FTPLIB
01831       status = yb_ftp_open(filename, (FTP_CON **) & ftp_con);
01832       if (status != SS_SUCCESS) {
01833          *hDev = 0;
01834          return status;
01835       } else
01836          *hDev = 1;
01837 #else
01838       cm_msg(MERROR, "yb_any_file_wopen", "FTP support not included");
01839       return SS_FILE_ERROR;
01840 #endif
01841    }
01842 
01843    return status;
01844 }
01845 
01846 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01847 INT yb_any_file_wclose(INT handle, INT type, INT data_fmt)
01848 /********************************************************************
01849 Routine: external yb_any_file_wclose
01850 Purpose: Close a data file used for replay for the given data format
01851 Input:
01852 INT data_fmt :  YBOS or MIDAS 
01853 Output:
01854 none
01855 Function value:
01856 status : from lower function
01857 *******************************************************************/
01858 {
01859    INT status;
01860    status = SS_SUCCESS;
01861    switch (type) {
01862    case LOG_TYPE_TAPE:
01863       /* writing EOF mark on tape Fonly */
01864       status = ss_tape_write_eof(handle);
01865       ss_tape_close(handle);
01866       break;
01867    case LOG_TYPE_DISK:
01868       /* close file */
01869       if (handle != 0)
01870 #ifdef OS_WINNT
01871          CloseHandle((HANDLE) handle);
01872 #else
01873          close(handle);
01874 #endif
01875       break;
01876    case LOG_TYPE_FTP:
01877 #ifdef INCLUDE_FTPLIB
01878       ftp_close(ftp_con);
01879       ftp_bye(ftp_con);
01880 #endif
01881       break;
01882    }
01883    if (status != SS_SUCCESS)
01884       return status;
01885    return (YB_SUCCESS);
01886 }
01887 
01888 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01889 INT yb_any_dev_os_read(INT handle, INT type, void *prec, DWORD nbytes, DWORD * readn)
01890 /********************************************************************\
01891 Routine: yb_any_dev_os_read
01892 Purpose: read nbytes from the type device.
01893 Input:
01894 INT  handle        file handler
01895 INT  type          Type of device (TAPE or DISK)
01896 void * prec        pointer to the record
01897 DWORD nbytes       # of bytes to read
01898 Output:
01899 DWORD *readn       # of bytes read
01900 Function value:
01901 YB_DONE            No more record to read
01902 YB_SUCCESS         Ok
01903 \********************************************************************/
01904 {
01905    INT status;
01906    if (type == LOG_TYPE_DISK)
01907       /* --------- DISK ---------- */
01908    {
01909       *readn = read(handle, prec, nbytes);
01910       if (*readn <= 0)
01911          status = SS_FILE_ERROR;
01912       else
01913          status = SS_SUCCESS;
01914       return status;
01915    }
01916    /* --------- TAPE ---------- */
01917 #ifdef OS_UNIX
01918    else if (type == LOG_TYPE_TAPE) {
01919       *readn = read(handle, prec, nbytes);
01920       if (*readn <= 0)
01921          status = SS_FILE_ERROR;
01922       else
01923          status = SS_SUCCESS;
01924       return status;
01925    }
01926 #endif
01927 
01928 #ifdef OS_WINNT
01929    else if (type == LOG_TYPE_TAPE) {
01930       if (!ReadFile((HANDLE) handle, prec, nbytes, readn, NULL))
01931          status = GetLastError();
01932       else
01933          status = SS_SUCCESS;
01934       if (status == ERROR_NO_DATA_DETECTED)
01935          status = SS_END_OF_TAPE;
01936 
01937       return status;
01938    }
01939 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
01940    else
01941       return SS_SUCCESS;
01942 }
01943 
01944 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01945 INT yb_any_dev_os_write(INT handle, INT type, void *prec, DWORD nbytes, DWORD * written)
01946 /********************************************************************\
01947 Routine: yb_any_dev_os_write
01948 Purpose: write nbytes to the device. This function is YBOS independent
01949 (NO magta stuff for disk)
01950 Input:
01951 INT  handle        file handler
01952 INT  type          Type of device (TAPE or DISK)
01953 void * prec        pointer to the record
01954 DWORD   nbytes     record length to be written
01955 Output:
01956 DWORD *written     # of written bytes
01957 Function value:
01958 INT status           # of written bytes or ERROR
01959 SS_FILE_ERROR      write error
01960 SS_SUCCESS         Ok
01961 \********************************************************************/
01962 {
01963    INT status;
01964    if (type == LOG_TYPE_DISK)
01965 #ifdef OS_WINNT
01966    {                            /* --------- DISK ---------- */
01967       WriteFile((HANDLE) handle, (char *) prec, nbytes, written, NULL);
01968       status = *written == nbytes ? SS_SUCCESS : SS_FILE_ERROR;
01969       return status;            /* return for DISK */
01970    }
01971 #else
01972    {                            /* --------- DISK ---------- */
01973       status = *written =
01974           write(handle, (char *) prec, nbytes) == nbytes ? SS_SUCCESS : SS_FILE_ERROR;
01975       return status;            /* return for DISK */
01976    }
01977 #endif
01978    else if (type == LOG_TYPE_TAPE) {    /* --------- TAPE ---------- */
01979 #ifdef OS_UNIX
01980       do {
01981          status = write(handle, (char *) prec, nbytes);
01982       } while (status == -1 && errno == EINTR);
01983       *written = status;
01984       if (*written != nbytes) {
01985          cm_msg(MERROR, "any_dev_os_write", strerror(errno));
01986          if (errno == EIO)
01987             return SS_IO_ERROR;
01988          if (errno == ENOSPC)
01989             return SS_NO_SPACE;
01990          else
01991             return SS_TAPE_ERROR;
01992       }
01993 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
01994 
01995 #ifdef OS_WINNT
01996       WriteFile((HANDLE) handle, (char *) prec, nbytes, written, NULL);
01997       if (*written != nbytes) {
01998          status = GetLastError();
01999          cm_msg(MERROR, "any_dev_os_write", "error %d", status);
02000          return SS_IO_ERROR;
02001       }
02002       return SS_SUCCESS;        /* return for TAPE */
02003 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
02004    } else if (type == LOG_TYPE_FTP)
02005 #ifdef INCLUDE_FTPLIB
02006    {
02007           status =
02008           (INT) ftp_send(ftp_con->data, (char *) prec,
02009                          (int) nbytes) == (int) nbytes ? SS_SUCCESS : SS_FILE_ERROR;
02010           *written = (DWORD) status;
02011       return status;
02012    }
02013 #else
02014    {
02015       cm_msg(MERROR, "ybos", "FTP support not included");
02016       return SS_IO_ERROR;
02017    }
02018 #endif
02019    return SS_SUCCESS;
02020 }
02021 
02022 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02023 INT yb_any_physrec_get(INT data_fmt, void **precord, DWORD * readn)
02024 /********************************************************************\
02025 Routine: external yb_any_physrec_get
02026 Purpose: Retrieve a physical record for the given data format
02027 Input:
02028 INT data_fmt :  YBOS or MIDAS 
02029 Output:
02030 void ** precord     pointer to the record
02031 DWORD * readn       record length in bytes
02032 Function value:
02033 status : from lower function
02034 \********************************************************************/
02035 {
02036    *precord = my.pmp;
02037    if (data_fmt == FORMAT_MIDAS)
02038       return midas_physrec_get(*precord, readn);
02039    else if (data_fmt == FORMAT_YBOS)
02040       return ybos_physrec_get((DWORD **) precord, readn);
02041    else
02042       return YB_UNKNOWN_FORMAT;
02043 }
02044 
02045 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02046 INT ybos_physrec_get(DWORD ** precord, DWORD * readn)
02047 /********************************************************************\
02048 Routine: ybos_physrec_get
02049 Purpose: read one physical YBOS record.
02050 The number of bytes to be read is fixed under YBOS.
02051 It is defined by my.size, In case of Disk file the magta
02052 stuff has to be read/rejected first.
02053 Input:
02054 void ** precord     pointer to the record
02055 DWORD * readn       record length in bytes
02056 Output:
02057 none
02058 Function value:
02059 YB_DONE            No more record to read
02060 YB_SUCCESS         Ok
02061 \********************************************************************/
02062 {
02063    INT status;
02064 
02065 #ifdef YBOS_VERSION_3_3
02066    if (my.magtafl) {
02067       /* skip 4 bytes from MAGTA header */
02068       if (!my.zipfile) {
02069          status = yb_any_dev_os_read(my.handle, my.type, my.pmagta, 4, readn);
02070          if (status != SS_SUCCESS)
02071             return (YB_DONE);
02072       } else {                  /* --------- GZIP ---------- */
02073 #ifdef INCLUDE_ZLIB
02074          status = gzread(filegz, (char *) my.pmagta, 4);
02075          if (status <= 0)
02076             return (YB_DONE);
02077 #endif
02078       }
02079    }
02080 #endif
02081 
02082    /* read full YBOS physical record */
02083    if (!my.zipfile) {
02084       status = yb_any_dev_os_read(my.handle, my.type, my.pyh, my.size << 2, readn);
02085       if (status != SS_SUCCESS)
02086          return (YB_DONE);
02087    } else {
02088 #ifdef INCLUDE_ZLIB
02089       status = gzread(filegz, (char *) my.pyh, my.size << 2);
02090       if (status <= 0)
02091          return (YB_DONE);
02092 #endif
02093    }
02094 
02095 #ifdef YBOS_VERSION_3_3
02096    /* check if header make sense for MAGTA there is extra stuff to get rid off */
02097    if ((!my.magtafl) && (*((DWORD *) my.pyh) == 0x00000004)) {
02098       /* set MAGTA flag */
02099       my.magtafl = TRUE;
02100       /* BOT of MAGTA skip record */
02101       if (!my.zipfile) {
02102          status = yb_any_dev_os_read(my.handle, my.type, my.pmagta, 8, readn);
02103          if (status != SS_SUCCESS)
02104             return (YB_DONE);
02105       } else {
02106 #ifdef INCLUDE_ZLIB
02107          status = gzread(filegz, (char *) my.pmagta, 8);
02108          if (status <= 0)
02109             return (YB_DONE);
02110 #endif
02111       }
02112 
02113       /* read full YBOS physical record */
02114       if (!my.zipfile) {
02115          status = yb_any_dev_os_read(my.handle, my.type, my.pyh, my.size << 2, readn);
02116          if (status != SS_SUCCESS)
02117             return (YB_DONE);
02118       } else {
02119 #ifdef INCLUDE_ZLIB
02120          status = gzread(filegz, (char *) my.pyh, my.size << 2);
02121          if (status <= 0)
02122             return (YB_DONE);
02123 #endif
02124       }
02125    }
02126 #endif
02127 
02128    /* move current ptr of newly phys rec to first event */
02129    if ((my.pyh)->offset == 0) {
02130       /* no new event ==> full phys rec is continuation of the previous event
02131          leave pointer to continuation */
02132       my.pyrd = (DWORD *) my.pyh + (my.pyh)->offset;
02133    } else {
02134       /* new event in physical record 
02135          leave pointer to plrl */
02136       my.pyrd = (DWORD *) my.pyh + (my.pyh)->offset;
02137    }
02138    /* count blocks */
02139    my.recn++;
02140 
02141    *precord = (DWORD *) (my.pyh);
02142 
02143    return (YB_SUCCESS);
02144 }
02145 
02146 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02147 INT midas_physrec_get(void *prec, DWORD * readn)
02148 /********************************************************************\
02149 Routine: midas_physrec_get
02150 Purpose: read one physical record.from a MIDAS run
02151 This is a "fake" physical record as Midas is
02152 not block structured. This function is used for
02153 reading a my.size record size. The return readn if different
02154 then my.size, will indicate a end of run. An extra read will
02155 indicate an eof.
02156 
02157 Input:
02158 void * prec        pointer to the record
02159 Output:
02160 DWORD *readn       retrieve number of bytes
02161 Function value:
02162 YB_DONE            No more record to read
02163 YB_SUCCESS         Ok
02164 \********************************************************************/
02165 {
02166    INT status = 0;
02167 
02168    /* read one block of data */
02169    if (!my.zipfile) {
02170       status = yb_any_dev_os_read(my.handle, my.type, prec, my.size, readn);
02171    } else {
02172 #ifdef INCLUDE_ZLIB
02173       *readn = gzread(filegz, (char *) prec, my.size);
02174       if (*readn <= 0)
02175          status = SS_FILE_ERROR;
02176       else
02177          status = SS_SUCCESS;
02178 #endif
02179    }
02180 
02181    if (status != SS_SUCCESS) {
02182       return (YB_DONE);
02183    } else {
02184       /* count blocks */
02185       my.recn++;
02186       return (YB_SUCCESS);
02187    }
02188 }
02189 
02190 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02191 INT yb_any_log_write(INT handle, INT data_fmt, INT type, void *prec, DWORD nbytes)
02192 /********************************************************************\
02193 Routine: external yb_any_log_write
02194 Purpose: Write a physical record to the out device, takes care of the
02195 magta under YBOS.
02196 
02197 Input:
02198 void handle   : file handle
02199 INT data_fmt  : YBOS or MIDAS 
02200 INT type      : Tape or disk 
02201 void *prec    : record pointer
02202 DWORD nbytes  : record length to be written
02203 Output:
02204 none
02205 Function value:
02206 status : from lower function  SS_SUCCESS, SS_FILE_ERROR
02207 \********************************************************************/
02208 {
02209    INT status;
02210    DWORD written;
02211 
02212 #ifdef YBOS_VERSION_3_3
02213    if ((type == LOG_TYPE_DISK) && (data_fmt == FORMAT_YBOS)) {  /* add the magta record if going to disk */
02214       status =
02215           yb_any_dev_os_write(handle, type,
02216                               (char *) ((DWORD *) (magta + 2)), 4, &written);
02217       if (status != SS_SUCCESS)
02218          return status;
02219    }
02220 #endif
02221    /* write record */
02222    status = yb_any_dev_os_write(handle, type, prec, nbytes, &written);
02223    return status;
02224 }
02225 
02226 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02227 INT yb_any_physrec_skip(INT data_fmt, INT bl)
02228 /********************************************************************\
02229 Routine: external yb_any_physrec_skip
02230 Purpose: Skip physical record until block = bl for the given data
02231 format, Under midas the skip is an event as no physical 
02232 record is present under that format,
02233 Input:
02234 INT data_fmt :  YBOS or MIDAS 
02235 INT bl:         block number (-1==all, 0 = first block)
02236 in case of MIDAS the bl represent an event
02237 Output:
02238 none
02239 Function value:
02240 status : from lower function
02241 \********************************************************************/
02242 {
02243    INT status;
02244 
02245    if (data_fmt == FORMAT_MIDAS) {
02246       status = midas_event_skip(bl);
02247       return YB_SUCCESS;
02248    } else if (data_fmt == FORMAT_YBOS)
02249       return ybos_physrec_skip(bl);
02250    else
02251       return YB_UNKNOWN_FORMAT;
02252 }
02253 
02254 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02255 INT ybos_physrec_skip(INT bl)
02256 /********************************************************************\
02257 Routine: ybos_physrec_skip
02258 Purpose: skip physical record on a YBOS file.
02259 The physical record size is fixed (see ybos.h)
02260 Input:
02261 INT     bl            physical record number. (start at 0)
02262 if bl = -1 : skip skiping
02263 Output:
02264 none
02265 Function value:
02266 YB_SUCCESS        Ok
02267 \********************************************************************/
02268 {
02269    INT status;
02270    DWORD *prec, size;
02271 
02272    if (bl == -1) {
02273       if ((status = ybos_physrec_get(&prec, &size)) == YB_SUCCESS)
02274          return status;
02275    }
02276    while (ybos_physrec_get(&prec, &size) == YB_SUCCESS) {
02277       if ((INT) (my.pyh)->rec_num != bl) {
02278          printf("Skipping physical record_# ... ");
02279          printf("%ld \r", (my.pyh)->rec_num);
02280          fflush(stdout);
02281       } else {
02282          printf("\n");
02283          return YB_SUCCESS;
02284       }
02285    }
02286    return YB_DONE;
02287 }
02288 
02289 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02290 INT midas_event_skip(INT evtn)
02291 /********************************************************************\
02292 Routine: midas_event_skip
02293 Purpose: skip event on a MIDAS file.
02294 Input:
02295 INT     evtn          event record number. (start at 0)
02296 if evt = -1 : skip skiping
02297 Output:
02298 none
02299 Function value:
02300 YB_SUCCESS        Ok
02301 \********************************************************************/
02302 {
02303    void *pevent;
02304    DWORD size;
02305 
02306    size = MAX_EVENT_SIZE;
02307    if (evtn == -1) {
02308       /*    if(midas_event_get(&pevent, &size) == YB_SUCCESS) */
02309       return YB_SUCCESS;
02310    }
02311    while (midas_event_get(&pevent, &size) == YB_SUCCESS) {
02312       if ((INT) my.evtn < evtn) {
02313          printf("Skipping event_# ... ");
02314          printf("%ld \r", my.evtn);
02315          fflush(stdout);
02316       } else {
02317          printf("\n");
02318          return YB_SUCCESS;
02319       }
02320    }
02321    return YB_DONE;
02322 }
02323 
02324 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02325 INT yb_any_physrec_display(INT data_fmt)
02326 /********************************************************************\
02327 Routine: external yb_any_physrec_display
02328 Purpose: Display the physical record of the current record 
02329 for the given data format.
02330 Not possible for MIDAS as no physical record structure
02331 Input:
02332 INT data_fmt :  YBOS or MIDAS 
02333 Output:
02334 none
02335 Function value:
02336 status          Lower function
02337 \********************************************************************/
02338 {
02339    INT bz, j, i, k;
02340    DWORD *prec;
02341 
02342    if (data_fmt == FORMAT_MIDAS) {
02343       printf(">>> No physical record structure for Midas format <<<\n");
02344       return YB_DONE;
02345    } else if (data_fmt == FORMAT_YBOS) {
02346       yb_any_all_info_display(D_RECORD);
02347       bz = (my.pyh)->rec_size + 1;
02348       /* adjust local pointer to top of record to include record header */
02349       prec = (DWORD *) (my.pyh);
02350       k = (my.pyh)->rec_num;
02351       for (i = 0; i < bz; i += NLINE) {
02352          printf("R(%d)[%d] = ", k, i);
02353          for (j = 0; j < NLINE; j++) {
02354             if (i + j < bz) {
02355                printf("%8.8lx ", *prec);
02356                prec++;
02357             }
02358          }
02359          printf("\n");
02360       }
02361       return (YB_SUCCESS);
02362    } else
02363       return YB_UNKNOWN_FORMAT;
02364 }
02365 
02366 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02367 INT yb_any_all_info_display(INT what)
02368 /********************************************************************\
02369 Routine: yb_any_all_info_display
02370 Purpose: display on screen all the info about "what".
02371 Input:
02372 INT     what              type of display.
02373 Output:
02374 none
02375 Function value:
02376 INT                 YB_SUCCESS
02377 YB_DONE
02378 \********************************************************************/
02379 {
02380    if (my.fmt == FORMAT_YBOS) {
02381       DWORD bz, hyl, ybn, of;
02382 
02383       bz = (my.pyh)->rec_size;
02384       hyl = (my.pyh)->header_length;
02385       ybn = (my.pyh)->rec_num;
02386       of = (my.pyh)->offset;
02387       switch (what) {
02388       case D_RECORD:
02389       case D_HEADER:
02390          printf("rec#%ld- ", my.recn);
02391          printf("%5ldbz %5ldhyl %5ldybn %5ldof\n", bz, hyl, ybn, of);
02392          break;
02393       case D_EVTLEN:
02394          printf("rec#%ld- ", my.recn);
02395          printf("%5ldbz %5ldhyl %5ldybn %5ldof ", bz, hyl, ybn, of);
02396          printf("%5ldel/x%lx %5ldev\n", my.evtlen, my.evtlen, my.evtn);
02397          break;
02398       }
02399    } else if (my.fmt == FORMAT_MIDAS) {
02400       DWORD mbn, run, ser;
02401       WORD id, msk;
02402       mbn = my.evtn;
02403       run = my.runn;
02404       id = my.pmh->event_id;
02405       msk = my.pmh->trigger_mask;
02406       ser = my.pmh->serial_number;
02407       switch (what) {
02408       case D_RECORD:
02409       case D_HEADER:
02410          printf(">>> No physical record structure for Midas format <<<\n");
02411          return YB_DONE;
02412          break;
02413       case D_EVTLEN:
02414          printf("Evt#%ld- ", my.evtn);
02415          printf("%lirun 0x%4.4uxid 0x%4.4uxmsk %5ldmevt#", run, id, msk, mbn);
02416          printf("%5ldel/x%lx %5ldserial\n", my.evtlen, my.evtlen, ser);
02417          break;
02418       }
02419    }
02420    return YB_SUCCESS;
02421 }
02422 
02423 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02424 INT yb_any_event_swap(INT data_fmt, void *pevent)
02425 /********************************************************************\
02426 Routine: external yb_any_event_swap
02427 Purpose: Swap an event from the given data format.
02428 Input:
02429 INT data_fmt  : YBOS or MIDAS 
02430 void * pevent : pointer to either plrl or pheader
02431 Output:
02432 none
02433 Function value:
02434 status :  from the lower function
02435 \********************************************************************/
02436 {
02437    INT status;
02438    BANK_HEADER *pbh;
02439 
02440    if (data_fmt == FORMAT_MIDAS) {
02441       if ((((EVENT_HEADER *) pevent)->event_id == EVENTID_BOR) ||
02442           (((EVENT_HEADER *) pevent)->event_id == EVENTID_EOR) ||
