02443           (((EVENT_HEADER *) pevent)->event_id == EVENTID_MESSAGE))
02444          return SS_SUCCESS;
02445       pbh = (BANK_HEADER *) (((EVENT_HEADER *) pevent) + 1);
02446       status = bk_swap(pbh, FALSE);
02447       return status == CM_SUCCESS ? YB_EVENT_NOT_SWAPPED : YB_SUCCESS;
02448    } else if (data_fmt == FORMAT_YBOS) {
02449       status = ybos_event_swap((DWORD *) pevent);
02450       return status == YB_EVENT_NOT_SWAPPED ? YB_SUCCESS : status;
02451    }
02452 
02453    return YB_UNKNOWN_FORMAT;
02454 }
02455 
02456 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02457 INT ybos_event_swap(DWORD * plrl)
02458 /********************************************************************\
02459 Routine: ybos_event_swap
02460 Purpose: byte swap the entire YBOS event if necessary.
02461 chekc necessity of swapping by looking at the 
02462 bank type being < MAX_BKTYPE 
02463 Input:
02464 DWORD * plrl           pointer to the YBOS event
02465 Output:
02466 none
02467 Function value:
02468 YB_SUCCESS             Event has been swapped
02469 YB_EVENT_NOT_SWAPPED   Event has been not been swapped
02470 YB_SWAP_ERROR          swapping error
02471 \********************************************************************/
02472 {
02473    DWORD *pevt, *pnextb, *pendevt;
02474    DWORD bank_length, bank_type;
02475 
02476    /* check if event has to be swapped */
02477    if ((((YBOS_BANK_HEADER *) (plrl + 1))->type) < MAX_BKTYPE)
02478       return (YB_EVENT_NOT_SWAPPED);
02479 
02480    /* swap LRL */
02481    DWORD_SWAP(plrl);
02482    pevt = plrl + 1;
02483 
02484    /* end of event pointer */
02485    pendevt = pevt + *plrl;
02486 
02487    /* scan event */
02488    while (pevt < pendevt) {
02489       /* swap YBOS bank header for sure */
02490       /* bank name doesn't have to be swapped as it's an ASCII coded */
02491       pevt++;                   /* bank name */
02492 
02493       DWORD_SWAP(pevt);         /* bank number */
02494       pevt++;
02495 
02496       DWORD_SWAP(pevt);         /* bank index */
02497       pevt++;
02498 
02499       DWORD_SWAP(pevt);         /* bank length */
02500       bank_length = *pevt++;
02501 
02502       DWORD_SWAP(pevt);         /* bank type */
02503       bank_type = *pevt++;
02504 
02505       /* pevt left pointing at first data in bank */
02506 
02507       /* pointer to next bank (-1 due to type inclided in length #$%@ */
02508       pnextb = pevt + bank_length - 1;
02509 
02510       switch (bank_type) {
02511       case D8_BKTYPE:
02512          while ((BYTE *) pevt < (BYTE *) pnextb) {
02513             QWORD_SWAP(pevt);
02514             pevt = (DWORD *) (((double *) pevt) + 1);
02515          }
02516          break;
02517       case I4_BKTYPE:
02518       case F4_BKTYPE:
02519          while ((BYTE *) pevt < (BYTE *) pnextb) {
02520             DWORD_SWAP(pevt);
02521             pevt++;
02522          }
02523          break;
02524       case I2_BKTYPE:
02525          while ((BYTE *) pevt < (BYTE *) pnextb) {
02526             WORD_SWAP(pevt);
02527             pevt = (DWORD *) (((WORD *) pevt) + 1);
02528          }
02529          break;
02530       case I1_BKTYPE:
02531       case A1_BKTYPE:
02532          pevt = pnextb;
02533          break;
02534       default:
02535          printf("ybos_swap_event-E- Unknown bank type %li\n", bank_type);
02536          return (YB_SWAP_ERROR);
02537          break;
02538       }
02539    }
02540    return (YB_SUCCESS);
02541 }
02542 
02543 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02544 INT yb_any_event_get(INT data_fmt, void **pevent, DWORD * readn)
02545 /********************************************************************\
02546 Routine: external yb_any_event_get
02547 Purpose: Retrieve an event from the given data format.
02548 Input:
02549 INT data_fmt :  YBOS or MIDAS 
02550 void ** pevent : either plrl or pheader
02551 Output:
02552 DWORD * readn : number of bytes read
02553 Function value:
02554 status : from lower function
02555 \********************************************************************/
02556 {
02557    INT status = 0;
02558 
02559    *pevent = NULL;
02560    if (data_fmt == FORMAT_MIDAS)
02561       status = midas_event_get(pevent, readn);
02562    else if (data_fmt == FORMAT_YBOS)
02563       status = ybos_event_get((DWORD **) pevent, readn);
02564    return (status);
02565 }
02566 
02567 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02568 INT ybos_event_get(DWORD ** plrl, DWORD * readn)
02569 /********************************************************************\
02570 Routine: ybos_event_get
02571 Purpose: read one YBOS event.
02572 detect the end of run by checking the *plrl content (-1)
02573 Input:
02574 Output:
02575 DWORD ** plrl      points to LRL valid full YBOS event
02576 DWORD * readn      event size in Bytes 
02577 Function value:
02578 YB_DONE           No more record to read
02579 YB_SUCCESS        Ok
02580 \********************************************************************/
02581 {
02582    DWORD size, fpart, lpart, evt_length;
02583    DWORD *ptmp, *prec;
02584    INT status;
02585 
02586    /* detect end of run (no more events) 
02587       by checking the *pyrd == -1 */
02588    if ((INT) (*my.pyrd) == -1)
02589       return YB_DONE;
02590    /* extract event to local event area
02591       event may not be complete if larger then physical record size
02592       will be taken care below, ADD the lrl  */
02593    evt_length = *(my.pyrd) + 1;
02594    memcpy((char *) my.pylrl, (char *) my.pyrd, evt_length << 2);
02595 
02596    /* extract lrl in I*4 and include itself (lrl) */
02597 
02598    /* stop if LRL  = -1 ... I don't think it is necessary but I leave it in for now
02599       or forever... */
02600    if (evt_length - 1 == -1)
02601       return (YB_DONE);
02602 
02603    /* check if event cross physical record boundary */
02604    if ((my.pyrd + evt_length) >= (DWORD *) my.pyh + my.size) {
02605       /* upcomming event crosses block, then first copy first part of event */
02606       /* compute max copy for first part of event */
02607       fpart = (DWORD *) my.pyh + my.size - my.pyrd;
02608       memcpy((char *) my.pylrl, (char *) my.pyrd, fpart << 2);
02609 
02610       /* adjust temporary evt pointer all in I*4 */
02611       ptmp = my.pylrl + fpart;
02612 
02613       if ((evt_length - fpart) == 0) {
02614          /* get next physical record */
02615          if ((status = ybos_physrec_get(&prec, &size)) != YB_SUCCESS)
02616             return (status);
02617          my.pyrd = (DWORD *) my.pyh + my.pyh->header_length;
02618       } else {
02619          while ((evt_length - fpart) > 0) {
02620             lpart = evt_length - fpart;
02621             if (lpart > (YBOS_PHYREC_SIZE - YBOS_HEADER_LENGTH))
02622                lpart = (YBOS_PHYREC_SIZE - YBOS_HEADER_LENGTH);
02623 
02624             /* get next physical record */
02625             if ((status = ybos_physrec_get(&prec, &size)) != YB_SUCCESS)
02626                return (status);
02627 
02628             /* pyrd is left at the next lrl but here we comming from
02629                a cross boundary request so read just the pyrd to 
02630                pyh+header_length */
02631             my.pyrd = (DWORD *) my.pyh + my.pyh->header_length;
02632             /* now copy remaining from temporary pointer */
02633             memcpy((char *) ptmp, (char *) my.pyrd, lpart << 2);
02634 
02635             /* adjust pointer to next valid data (LRL) 
02636                should be equivalent to pyh+pyh->offset */
02637             my.pyrd += lpart;
02638             fpart += lpart;
02639             ptmp += lpart;
02640          }
02641       }
02642       if (my.pyrd != (DWORD *) my.pyh + my.pyh->offset) {
02643          printf(" event misalignment !! %p  %p \n",
02644                 my.pyrd, (DWORD *) my.pyh + my.pyh->offset);
02645          printf("Event crossed boundary: length %ld\n", evt_length);
02646          my.pyrd = (DWORD *) my.pyh + my.pyh->offset;
02647       }
02648 
02649    } else {
02650       /* adjust pointer to next valid data (LRL) */
02651       my.pyrd += evt_length;
02652    }
02653    /* count event */
02654    my.evtn++;
02655 
02656   /*-PAA- Dec99 Danny adjust event size in I*4 */
02657    my.evtlen = evt_length;
02658    /* in bytes for the world */
02659    *readn = my.evtlen << 2;
02660    *plrl = (DWORD *) my.pylrl;
02661    return (YB_SUCCESS);
02662 }
02663 
02664 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02665 INT midas_event_get(void **pevent, DWORD * readn)
02666 /********************************************************************\
02667 Routine: midas_event_get
02668 Purpose: read one MIDAS event.
02669 Will detect:
02670 The first pass in getting the record number being -1
02671 The last pass in checking the midas_physrec_get() readn
02672 being different then the my.size then flushing the current
02673 buffer until pointer goes beyond last event.
02674 Input:
02675 void ** pevent     points to MIDAS HEADER 
02676 Output:
02677 DWORD * readn      event size in bytes (MIDAS)
02678 Function value:
02679 YB_DONE           No more record to read
02680 YB_SUCCESS        Ok
02681 \********************************************************************/
02682 {
02683    INT status, leftover;
02684    DWORD fpart;
02685    static DWORD size = 0;
02686 
02687    /* save pointer */
02688    *pevent = (char *) my.pmh;
02689    if (size == 0)
02690       size = my.size;
02691 
02692    /* first time in get physrec once */
02693    if (my.recn == -1) {
02694       status = midas_physrec_get((void *) my.pmp, &size);
02695       if (status != YB_SUCCESS)
02696          return (YB_DONE);
02697    }
02698 
02699   /*-PAA- Jul 12/2002
02700     if (((my.pmp+size) - (char *)my.pme) == 0)
02701         return (YB_DONE);
02702   */
02703 
02704    /* copy header only */
02705    if (((my.pmp + size) - (char *) my.pme) < sizeof(EVENT_HEADER)) {
02706       fpart = (my.pmp + my.size) - (char *) my.pme;
02707       memcpy(my.pmh, my.pme, fpart);
02708       my.pmh = (EVENT_HEADER *) (((char *) my.pmh) + fpart);
02709       leftover = sizeof(EVENT_HEADER) - fpart;
02710       status = midas_physrec_get((void *) my.pmp, &size);
02711       if (status != YB_SUCCESS)
02712          return (YB_DONE);
02713       memset(my.pmp + size, -1, my.size - size);
02714       my.pme = (EVENT_HEADER *) my.pmp;
02715       memcpy(my.pmh, my.pme, leftover);
02716       my.pme = (EVENT_HEADER *) (((char *) my.pme) + leftover);
02717       my.pmh = (EVENT_HEADER *) * pevent;
02718    } else {
02719       memcpy(my.pmh, my.pme, sizeof(EVENT_HEADER));
02720       my.pme = (EVENT_HEADER *) (((char *) my.pme) + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER));
02721    }
02722    /* leave with pmh  to destination header
02723       pmrd to destination event (pmh+1)
02724       pme  to source event
02725     */
02726    my.pmrd = (char *) (my.pmh + 1);
02727 
02728    /* check for end of file */
02729    if (my.pmh->event_id == -1)
02730       return YB_DONE;
02731 
02732    /* copy event (without header) */
02733    leftover = my.pmh->data_size;
02734 
02735    /* check for block crossing */
02736    while (((my.pmp + size) - (char *) my.pme) < leftover) {
02737       fpart = (my.pmp + my.size) - (char *) my.pme;
02738       memcpy(my.pmrd, my.pme, fpart);
02739       my.pmrd += fpart;
02740       leftover -= fpart;
02741       status = midas_physrec_get((void *) my.pmp, &size);
02742       if (status != YB_SUCCESS)
02743          return (YB_DONE);
02744       memset(my.pmp + size, -1, my.size - size);
02745       my.pme = (EVENT_HEADER *) my.pmp;
02746    }
02747 
02748    /* copy left over or full event if no Xing */
02749    *readn = my.evtlen = my.pmh->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER);
02750    memcpy(my.pmrd, my.pme, leftover);
02751    my.pme = (EVENT_HEADER *) (((char *) my.pme) + leftover);
02752    my.evtn++;
02753    return YB_SUCCESS;
02754 }
02755 
02756 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02757 void yb_any_event_display(void *pevent, INT data_fmt, INT dsp_mode, INT dsp_fmt)
02758 /********************************************************************\
02759 Routine: external yb_any_event_display
02760 Purpose: display on screen the YBOS event in either RAW or YBOS mode
02761 and in either Decimal or Hexadecimal.
02762 Input:
02763 void *  pevent     pointer to either plrl or pheader.
02764 INT     data_fmt   uses the YBOS or MIDAS event structure
02765 INT     dsp_mode   display in RAW or Bank mode
02766 INT     dsp_fmt    display format (DSP_DEC/HEX)
02767 Output:
02768 none
02769 Function value:
02770 none
02771 \********************************************************************/
02772 {
02773    if (dsp_mode == DSP_RAW)
02774       yb_any_raw_event_display(pevent, data_fmt, dsp_fmt);
02775    else if (dsp_mode == DSP_BANK)
02776       yb_any_bank_event_display(pevent, data_fmt, dsp_fmt);
02777    else
02778       printf("yb_any_event_display- Unknown format:%i\n", dsp_fmt);
02779    return;
02780 }
02781 
02782 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02783 void yb_any_raw_event_display(void *pevent, INT data_fmt, INT dsp_fmt)
02784 /********************************************************************\
02785 Routine: yb_any_raw_event_display
02786 Purpose: display on screen the RAW data of either YBOS or MIDAS format.
02787 Input:
02788 DWORD *  pevent         points to either plrl or pheader
02789 INT     data_fmt        uses the YBOS or MIDAS event structure
02790 INT      dsp_fmt        display format (DSP_DEC/HEX)
02791 Output:
02792 none
02793 Function value:
02794 none
02795 \********************************************************************/
02796 {
02797    DWORD lrl = 0, *pevt = NULL, j, i, total = 0;
02798 
02799    if (data_fmt == FORMAT_YBOS) {
02800       lrl = *((DWORD *) (pevent)) + 1;  /* include itself */
02801       pevt = (DWORD *) pevent;  /* local copy starting from the plrl */
02802    } else if (data_fmt == FORMAT_MIDAS) {
02803       lrl = ((((EVENT_HEADER *) pevent)->data_size) + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER)) / sizeof(DWORD);    /* in I*4 for raw including the header */
02804       pevt = (DWORD *) pevent;  /* local copy starting from the pheader */
02805    }
02806 
02807    for (i = 0; i < lrl; i += NLINE) {
02808       printf("%6.0ld->: ", total);
02809       for (j = 0; j < NLINE; j++) {
02810          if ((i + j) < lrl) {
02811             if (dsp_fmt == DSP_DEC)
02812                printf("%8.li ", *pevt);
02813             else
02814                printf("%8.8lx ", *pevt);
02815             pevt++;
02816          }
02817       }
02818       total += NLINE;
02819       printf("\n");
02820    }
02821 }
02822 
02823 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02824 void yb_any_bank_event_display(void *pevent, INT data_fmt, INT dsp_fmt)
02825 /********************************************************************\
02826 Routine: ybos_bank_event_display
02827 Purpose: display on screen the event header, bank list and bank content
02828 for either ybos or midas format. In case of ybos check is EVID is 
02829 present if so extract its content (see macro ybos.h)
02830 Input:
02831 void * pevent          points to either plrl or pheader
02832 INT     data_fmt       uses the YBOS or MIDAS event structure
02833 INT     dsp_fmt        display format (DSP_DEC/HEX)
02834 Output:
02835 none
02836 Function value:
02837 none
02838 \********************************************************************/
02839 {
02840    char banklist[YB_STRING_BANKLIST_MAX];
02841    YBOS_BANK_HEADER *pybk;
02842    DWORD *pdata;
02843    DWORD bklen, bktyp;
02844    BANK_HEADER *pbh;
02845    BANK *pmbk;
02846    BANK32 *pmbk32;
02847    EVENT_HEADER *pheader;
02848    INT status;
02849 
02850    if (data_fmt == FORMAT_YBOS) {
02851       /* event header --> No event header in YBOS */
02852 
02853       /* bank list */
02854       status = ybk_list((DWORD *) pevent, banklist);
02855       printf("#banks:%i - Bank list:-%s-\n", status, banklist);
02856 
02857       /* check if EVID is present if so display its content */
02858       if ((status =
02859            ybk_find((DWORD *) pevent, "EVID", &bklen, &bktyp,
02860                     (void **) &pybk)) == YB_SUCCESS) {
02861          pdata = (DWORD *) ((YBOS_BANK_HEADER *) pybk + 1);
02862          printf
02863              ("--------- EVID --------- Event# %li ------Run#:%li--------\n",
02864               YBOS_EVID_EVENT_NB(pdata), YBOS_EVID_RUN_NUMBER(pdata));
02865          printf
02866              ("Evid:%4.4x- Mask:%4.4x- Serial:%li- Time:0x%lx- Dsize:%li/0x%lx",
02867               (WORD) YBOS_EVID_EVENT_ID(pdata), (WORD) YBOS_EVID_TRIGGER_MASK(pdata)
02868               , YBOS_EVID_SERIAL(pdata), YBOS_EVID_TIME(pdata)
02869               , ((YBOS_BANK_HEADER *) pybk)->length, ((YBOS_BANK_HEADER *) pybk)->length);
02870       }
02871 
02872       /* display bank content */
02873       pybk = NULL;
02874       while ((ybk_iterate((DWORD *) pevent, &pybk, (void **) &pdata) >= 0)
02875              && (pybk != NULL))
02876          ybos_bank_display(pybk, dsp_fmt);
02877    } else if (data_fmt == FORMAT_MIDAS) {
02878       /* skip these special events (NO bank structure) */
02879       pheader = (EVENT_HEADER *) pevent;
02880       if (pheader->event_id == EVENTID_BOR ||
02881           pheader->event_id == EVENTID_EOR || pheader->event_id == EVENTID_MESSAGE)
02882          return;
02883 
02884       /* event header */
02885       printf
02886           ("Evid:%4.4x- Mask:%4.4x- Serial:%li- Time:0x%lx- Dsize:%li/0x%lx",
02887            (WORD) pheader->event_id, (WORD) pheader->trigger_mask,
02888            pheader->serial_number, pheader->time_stamp, pheader->data_size,
02889            pheader->data_size);
02890 
02891       /* check if format is MIDAS or FIXED */
02892       pbh = (BANK_HEADER *) (pheader + 1);
02893       if ((pbh->data_size + 8) == pheader->data_size) {
02894          /* bank list */
02895          status = bk_list((BANK_HEADER *) (pheader + 1), banklist);
02896          printf("\n#banks:%i - Bank list:-%s-\n", status, banklist);
02897 
02898          /* display bank content */
02899          if (bk_is32(pbh)) {
02900             pmbk32 = NULL;
02901             do {
02902                bk_iterate32(pbh, &pmbk32, &pdata);
02903                if (pmbk32 != NULL)
02904                   midas_bank_display32(pmbk32, dsp_fmt);
02905             } while (pmbk32 != NULL);
02906          } else {
02907             pmbk = NULL;
02908             do {
02909                bk_iterate(pbh, &pmbk, &pdata);
02910                if (pmbk != NULL)
02911                   midas_bank_display(pmbk, dsp_fmt);
02912             } while (pmbk != NULL);
02913          }
02914       } else {
02915          printf("\nFIXED event with Midas Header\n");
02916          yb_any_raw_event_display(pevent, data_fmt, dsp_fmt);
02917       }
02918    }
02919    return;
02920 }
02921 
02922 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02923 void yb_any_bank_display(void *pmbh, void *pbk, INT data_fmt, INT dsp_mode, INT dsp_fmt)
02924 /********************************************************************\
02925 Routine: external yb_any_bank_display
02926 Purpose: display on screen the given bank.
02927 Input:
02928 void * pbk          pointer to the bank
02929 INT  data_fmt       YBOS or MIDAS
02930 INT  dsp_mode       display mode (RAW/BANK)
02931 INT  dsp_fmt        display format (DSP_DEC/HEX)
02932 Output:             
02933 none
02934 Function value:
02935 none
02936 \********************************************************************/
02937 {
02938    if (dsp_mode == DSP_RAW)
02939       yb_any_raw_bank_display(pbk, data_fmt, dsp_fmt);
02940    else {
02941       if (data_fmt == FORMAT_MIDAS) {
02942          if (bk_is32(pmbh))
02943             midas_bank_display32((BANK32 *) pbk, dsp_fmt);
02944          else
02945             midas_bank_display((BANK *) pbk, dsp_fmt);
02946       } else if (data_fmt == FORMAT_YBOS)
02947          ybos_bank_display((YBOS_BANK_HEADER *) pbk, dsp_fmt);
02948    }
02949    return;
02950 }
02951 
02952 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02953 void yb_any_raw_bank_display(void *pbank, INT data_fmt, INT dsp_fmt)
02954 /********************************************************************\
02955 Routine: yb_any_raw_bank_display
02956 Purpose: display on screen the RAW data of a given YBOS/MIDAS bank.
02957 Input:
02958 void  * pbank          pointer to the bank name
02959 INT     data_fmt       uses the YBOS or MIDAS event structure
02960 INT     dsp_fmt        display format (DSP_DEC/HEX)
02961 Output:
02962 none
02963 Function value:
02964 none
02965 \********************************************************************/
02966 {
02967    DWORD *pdata = NULL, lrl = 0, j, i;
02968 
02969    if (data_fmt == FORMAT_YBOS) {
02970       lrl = (((YBOS_BANK_HEADER *) pbank)->length) - 1;
02971       pdata = (DWORD *) (((YBOS_BANK_HEADER *) pbank) + 1);
02972    } else if (data_fmt == FORMAT_MIDAS) {
02973       lrl = ((BANK *) pbank)->data_size >> 2;   /* in DWORD */
02974       pdata = (DWORD *) ((BANK *) (pbank) + 1);
02975    }
02976 
02977    for (i = 0; i < lrl; i += NLINE) {
02978       j = 0;
02979       printf("\n%4li-> ", i + j + 1);
02980       for (j = 0; j < NLINE; j++) {
02981          if ((i + j) < lrl) {
02982             if (dsp_fmt == DSP_DEC)
02983                printf("%8.li ", *((DWORD *) pdata));
02984             if (dsp_fmt == DSP_ASC)
02985                printf("%8.8lx ", *((DWORD *) pdata));
02986             if (dsp_fmt == DSP_HEX)
02987                printf("%8.8lx ", *((DWORD *) pdata));
02988             pdata++;
02989          }
02990       }
02991    }
02992 }
02993 
02994 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02995 void ybos_bank_display(YBOS_BANK_HEADER * pybk, INT dsp_fmt)
02996 /********************************************************************\
02997 Routine: ybos_event_display
02998 Purpose: display on screen the YBOS data in YBOS bank mode.
02999 Input:
03000 YBOS_BANK_HEADER * pybk     pointer to the bank header
03001 INT     dsp_fmt             display format (DSP_DEC/HEX)
03002 Output:             
03003 none
03004 Function value:
03005 none
03006 \********************************************************************/
03007 {
03008    char bank_name[5], strbktype[32];
03009    DWORD length_type = 0;
03010    DWORD *pdata, *pendbk;
03011    INT i, j;
03012 
03013    j = 8;                       /* elements within line */
03014    i = 1;                       /* data counter */
03015 
03016    pdata = (DWORD *) (pybk + 1);
03017    memcpy(&bank_name[0], (char *) &pybk->name, 4);
03018    bank_name[4] = 0;
03019 
03020    if (pybk->type == D8_BKTYPE) {
03021       length_type = ((pybk->length - 1) >> 1);
03022       sprintf(strbktype, "double*8 (FMT machine dependent)");
03023    }
03024    if (pybk->type == F4_BKTYPE) {
03025       length_type = pybk->length - 1;
03026       strcpy(strbktype, "Real*4 (FMT machine dependent)");
03027    }
03028    if (pybk->type == I4_BKTYPE) {
03029       length_type = pybk->length - 1;
03030       strcpy(strbktype, "Integer*4");
03031    }
03032    if (pybk->type == I2_BKTYPE) {
03033       length_type = ((pybk->length - 1) << 1);
03034       strcpy(strbktype, "Integer*2");
03035    }
03036    if (pybk->type == I1_BKTYPE) {
03037       length_type = ((pybk->length - 1) << 2);
03038       strcpy(strbktype, "8 bit Bytes");
03039    }
03040    if (pybk->type == A1_BKTYPE) {
03041       length_type = ((pybk->length - 1) << 2);
03042       strcpy(strbktype, "8 bit ASCII");
03043    }
03044    printf("\nBank:%s Length: %li(I*1)/%li(I*4)/%li(Type) Type:%s",
03045           bank_name, ((pybk->length - 1) << 2), pybk->length - 1, length_type, strbktype);
03046    j = 16;
03047 
03048    pendbk = pdata + pybk->length - 1;
03049    while ((BYTE *) pdata < (BYTE *) pendbk) {
03050       switch (pybk->type) {
03051       case D8_BKTYPE:
03052          if (j > 7) {
03053             printf("\n%4i-> ", i);
03054             j = 0;
03055             i += 8;
03056          }
03057          printf("%15.5le  ", *((double *) pdata));
03058          pdata = (DWORD *) (((double *) pdata) + 1);
03059          j++;
03060          break;
03061       case F4_BKTYPE:
03062          if (j > 7) {
03063             printf("\n%4i-> ", i);
03064             j = 0;
03065             i += 8;
03066          }
03067          if ((dsp_fmt == DSP_DEC) || (dsp_fmt == DSP_UNK))
03068             printf("%8.3e ", *((float *) pdata));
03069          if (dsp_fmt == DSP_HEX)
03070             printf("0x%8.8lx ", *((DWORD *) pdata));
03071          pdata++;
03072          j++;
03073          break;
03074       case I4_BKTYPE:
03075          if (j > 7) {
03076             printf("\n%4i-> ", i);
03077             j = 0;
03078             i += 8;
03079          }
03080          if (dsp_fmt == DSP_DEC)
03081             printf("%8.1li ", *((DWORD *) pdata));
03082          if ((dsp_fmt == DSP_HEX) || (dsp_fmt == DSP_UNK))
03083             printf("0x%8.8lx ", *((DWORD *) pdata));
03084          pdata++;
03085          j++;
03086          break;
03087       case I2_BKTYPE:
03088          if (j > 7) {
03089             printf("\n%4i-> ", i);
03090             j = 0;
03091             i += 8;
03092          }
03093          if (dsp_fmt == DSP_DEC)
03094             printf("%5.1i ", *((WORD *) pdata));
03095          if ((dsp_fmt == DSP_HEX) || (dsp_fmt == DSP_UNK))
03096             printf("0x%4.4x ", *((WORD *) pdata));
03097          pdata = (DWORD *) (((WORD *) pdata) + 1);
03098          j++;
03099          break;
03100       case A1_BKTYPE:
03101          if (j > 15) {
03102             printf("\n%4i-> ", i);
03103             j = 0;
03104             i += 16;
03105          }
03106          if ((dsp_fmt == DSP_ASC) || (dsp_fmt == DSP_UNK))
03107             printf("%1.1s ", (char *) pdata);
03108          if (dsp_fmt == DSP_DEC)
03109             printf("%2.i ", *((BYTE *) pdata));
03110          if (dsp_fmt == DSP_HEX)
03111             printf("0x%2.2x ", *((BYTE *) pdata));
03112          pdata = (DWORD *) (((BYTE *) pdata) + 1);
03113          j++;
03114          break;
03115       case I1_BKTYPE:
03116          if (j > 7) {
03117             printf("\n%4i-> ", i);
03118             j = 0;
03119             i += 8;
03120          }
03121          if ((dsp_fmt == DSP_DEC) || (dsp_fmt == DSP_UNK))
03122             printf("%4.i ", *((BYTE *) pdata));
03123          if (dsp_fmt == DSP_HEX)
03124             printf("0x%2.2x ", *((BYTE *) pdata));
03125          pdata = (DWORD *) (((BYTE *) pdata) + 1);
03126          j++;
03127          break;
03128       default:
03129          printf("ybos_bak_display-E- Unknown bank type %li\n", pybk->type);
03130          break;
03131 
03132       }                         /* switch */
03133    }                            /* while next bank */
03134    printf("\n");
03135    return;
03136 }
03137 
03138 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03139 void midas_bank_display(BANK * pbk, INT dsp_fmt)
03140 /******************************* *************************************\
03141 Routine: midas_bank_display
03142 Purpose: display on screen the pointed MIDAS bank data using MIDAS Bank structure.
03143 Input:
03144 BANK *  pbk            pointer to the BANK
03145 INT     dsp_fmt        display format (DSP_DEC/HEX)
03146 Output:
03147 none
03148 Function value:
03149 none
03150 \********************************************************************/
03151 {
03152    char bank_name[5], strbktype[32];
03153    char *pdata, *pendbk;
03154    DWORD length_type = 0, lrl;
03155    INT type, i, j;
03156 
03157    lrl = pbk->data_size;        /* in bytes */
03158    type = pbk->type & 0xff;
03159    bank_name[4] = 0;
03160    memcpy(bank_name, (char *) (pbk->name), 4);
03161    pdata = (char *) (pbk + 1);
03162 
03163    j = 64;                      /* elements within line */
03164    i = 1;                       /* data counter */
03165    strcpy(strbktype, "Unknown format");
03166    if (type == TID_DOUBLE) {
03167       length_type = sizeof(double);
03168       strcpy(strbktype, "double*8");
03169    }
03170    if (type == TID_FLOAT) {
03171       length_type = sizeof(float);
03172       strcpy(strbktype, "Real*4 (FMT machine dependent)");
03173    }
03174    if (type == TID_DWORD) {
03175       length_type = sizeof(DWORD);
03176       strcpy(strbktype, "Unsigned Integer*4");
03177    }
03178    if (type == TID_INT) {
03179       length_type = sizeof(INT);
03180       strcpy(strbktype, "Signed Integer*4");
03181    }
03182    if (type == TID_WORD) {
03183       length_type = sizeof(WORD);
03184       strcpy(strbktype, "Unsigned Integer*2");
03185    }
03186    if (type == TID_SHORT) {
03187       length_type = sizeof(short);
03188       strcpy(strbktype, "Signed Integer*2");
03189    }
03190    if (type == TID_BYTE) {
03191       length_type = sizeof(BYTE);
03192       strcpy(strbktype, "Unsigned Bytes");
03193    }
03194    if (type == TID_SBYTE) {
03195       length_type = sizeof(BYTE);
03196       strcpy(strbktype, "Signed Bytes");
03197    }
03198    if (type == TID_BOOL) {
03199       length_type = sizeof(DWORD);
03200       strcpy(strbktype, "Boolean");
03201    }
03202    if (type == TID_CHAR) {
03203       length_type = sizeof(char);
03204       strcpy(strbktype, "8 bit ASCII");
03205    }
03206    if (type == TID_STRUCT) {
03207       length_type = sizeof(char);
03208       strcpy(strbktype, "STRUCT (not supported->8 bits)");
03209    }
03210 
03211    printf("\nBank:%s Length: %li(I*1)/%li(I*4)/%li(Type) Type:%s",
03212           bank_name, lrl, lrl >> 2, lrl / length_type, strbktype);
03213 
03214    pendbk = pdata + lrl;
03215    while (pdata < pendbk) {
03216       switch (type) {
03217       case TID_DOUBLE:
03218          if (j > 3) {
03219             printf("\n%4i-> ", i);
03220             j = 0;
03221             i += 4;
03222          }
03223          printf("%15.5le    ", *((double *) pdata));
03224          pdata = (char *) (((double *) pdata) + 1);
03225          j++;
03226          break;
03227       case TID_FLOAT:
03228          if (j > 7) {
03229             printf("\n%4i-> ", i);
03230             j = 0;
03231             i += 8;
03232          }
03233          if ((dsp_fmt == DSP_DEC) || (dsp_fmt == DSP_UNK))
03234             printf("%8.3e ", *((float *) pdata));
03235          if (dsp_fmt == DSP_HEX)
03236             printf("0x%8.8lx ", *((DWORD *) pdata));
03237          pdata = (char *) (((DWORD *) pdata) + 1);
03238          j++;
03239          break;
03240       case TID_DWORD:
03241          if (j > 7) {
03242             printf("\n%4i-> ", i);
03243             j = 0;
03244             i += 8;
03245          }
03246          if (dsp_fmt == DSP_DEC)
03247             printf("%8.1li ", *((DWORD *) pdata));
03248          if ((dsp_fmt == DSP_HEX) || (dsp_fmt == DSP_UNK))
03249             printf("0x%8.8lx ", *((DWORD *) pdata));
03250          pdata = (char *) (((DWORD *) pdata) + 1);
03251          j++;
03252          break;
03253       case TID_INT:
03254          if (j > 7) {
03255             printf("\n%4i-> ", i);
03256             j = 0;
03257             i += 8;
03258          }
03259          if ((dsp_fmt == DSP_DEC) || (dsp_fmt == DSP_UNK))
03260             printf("%8.1li ", *((DWORD *) pdata));
03261          if (dsp_fmt == DSP_HEX)
03262             printf("0x%8.8lx ", *((DWORD *) pdata));
03263          pdata = (char *) (((DWORD *) pdata) + 1);
03264          j++;
03265          break;
03266       case TID_WORD:
03267          if (j > 7) {
03268             printf("\n%4i-> ", i);
03269             j = 0;
03270             i += 8;
03271          }
03272          if (dsp_fmt == DSP_DEC)
03273             printf("%5.1i ", *((WORD *) pdata));
03274          if ((dsp_fmt == DSP_HEX) || (dsp_fmt == DSP_UNK))
03275             printf("0x%4.4x ", *((WORD *) pdata));
03276          pdata = (char *) (((WORD *) pdata) + 1);
03277          j++;
03278          break;
03279       case TID_SHORT:
03280          if (j > 7) {
03281             printf("\n%4i-> ", i);
03282             j = 0;
03283             i += 8;
03284          }
03285          if ((dsp_fmt == DSP_DEC) || (dsp_fmt == DSP_UNK))
03286             printf("%5.1i ", *((short *) pdata));
03287          if (dsp_fmt == DSP_HEX)
03288             printf("0x%4.4x ", *((short *) pdata));
03289          pdata = (char *) (((short *) pdata) + 1);
03290          j++;
03291          break;
03292       case TID_BYTE:
03293       case TID_STRUCT:
03294          if (j > 15) {
03295             printf("\n%4i-> ", i);
03296             j = 0;
03297             i += 16;
03298          }
03299          if (dsp_fmt == DSP_DEC)
03300             printf("%4.i ", *((BYTE *) pdata));
03301          if ((dsp_fmt == DSP_HEX) || (dsp_fmt == DSP_UNK))
03302             printf("0x%2.2x ", *((BYTE *) pdata));
03303          pdata++;
03304          j++;
03305          break;
03306       case TID_SBYTE:
03307          if (j > 15) {
03308             printf("\n%4i-> ", i);
03309             j = 0;
03310             i += 16;
03311          }
03312          if ((dsp_fmt == DSP_DEC) || (dsp_fmt == DSP_UNK))
03313             printf("%4.i ", *((BYTE *) pdata));
03314          if (dsp_fmt == DSP_HEX)
03315             printf("0x%2.2x ", *((BYTE *) pdata));
03316          pdata++;
03317          j++;
03318          break;
03319       case TID_BOOL:
03320          if (j > 15) {
03321             printf("\n%4i-> ", i);
03322             j = 0;
03323             i += 16;
03324          }
03325          (*((BOOL *) pdata) != 0) ? printf("Y ") : printf("N ");
03326          pdata = (char *) (((DWORD *) pdata) + 1);
03327          j++;
03328          break;
03329       case TID_CHAR:
03330          if (j > 15) {
03331             printf("\n%4i-> ", i);
03332             j = 0;
03333             i += 16;
03334          }
03335          if (dsp_fmt == DSP_DEC)
03336             printf("%3.i ", *((BYTE *) pdata));
03337          if ((dsp_fmt == DSP_ASC) || (dsp_fmt == DSP_UNK))
03338             printf("%1.1s ", (char *) pdata);
03339          if (dsp_fmt == DSP_HEX)
03340             printf("0x%2.2x ", *((BYTE *) pdata));
03341          pdata++;
03342          j++;
03343          break;
03344       default:
03345          printf("bank type not supported (%d)\n", type);
03346          return;
03347          break;
03348       }
03349    }                            /* end of bank */
03350    printf("\n");
03351    return;
03352 }

03356 /********************************************************************\
03357 Routine: midas_bank_display32
03358 Purpose: display on screen the pointed MIDAS bank data using MIDAS Bank structure.
03359 for 32bit length banks
03360 Input:

03362 INT     dsp_fmt        display format (DSP_DEC/HEX)
03363 Output:
03364 none
03365 Function value:
03366 none
03367 \********************************************************************/
03368 {

03394    }

03398    }
03399    if (type == TID_WORD) {
03400       length_type = sizeof(WORD);

03425       strcpy(strbktype, "STRUCT (not supported->8 bits)");
03426    }
03427    printf("\nBank:%s Length: %li(I*1)/%li(I*4)/%li(Type) Type:%s",
03428           bank_name, lrl, lrl >> 2, lrl / length_type, strbktype);
03429

03431

03433       switch (type) {

03436             printf("\n%4i-> ", i);
03437             j = 0;
03438             i += 4;
03439          }
03440          printf("%15.5le    ", *((double *) pdata));
03441          pdata = (char *) (((double *) pdata) + 1);
03442          j++;
03443          break;
03444       case TID_FLOAT:
03445          if (j > 7) {
03446             printf("\n%4i-> ", i);
03447             j = 0;
03448             i += 8;
03449          }
03450          if ((dsp_fmt == DSP_DEC) || (dsp_fmt == DSP_UNK))
03451             printf("%8.3e ", *((float *) pdata));
03452          if (dsp_fmt == DSP_HEX)
03453             printf("0x%8.8lx ", *((DWORD *) pdata));
03454          pdata = (char *) (((DWORD *) pdata) + 1);
03455          j++;
03456          break;
03457       case TID_DWORD:
03458          if (j > 7) {
03459             printf("\n%4i-> ", i);
03460             j = 0;
03461             i += 8;
03462          }
03463          if (dsp_fmt == DSP_DEC)
03464             printf("%8.1li ", *((DWORD *) pdata));
03465          if ((dsp_fmt == DSP_HEX) || (dsp_fmt == DSP_UNK))
03466             printf("0x%8.8lx ", *((DWORD *) pdata));
03467          pdata = (char *) (((DWORD *) pdata) + 1);
03468          j++;
03469          break;
03470       case TID_INT:
03471          if (j > 7) {
03472             printf("\n%4i-> ", i);
03473             j = 0;
03474             i += 8;
03475          }
03476          if ((dsp_fmt == DSP_DEC) || (dsp_fmt == DSP_UNK))
03477             printf("%8.1li ", *((DWORD *) pdata));
03478          if (dsp_fmt == DSP_HEX)
03479             printf("0x%8.8lx ", *((DWORD *) pdata));
03480          pdata = (char *) (((DWORD *) pdata) + 1);
03481          j++;
03482          break;
03483       case TID_WORD:
03484          if (j > 7) {
03485             printf("\n%4i-> ", i);
03486             j = 0;
03487             i += 8;
03488          }
03489          if (dsp_fmt == DSP_DEC)
03490             printf("%5.1i ", *((WORD *) pdata));
03491          if ((dsp_fmt == DSP_HEX) || (dsp_fmt == DSP_UNK))
03492             printf("0x%4.4x ", *((WORD *) pdata));
03493          pdata = (char *) (((WORD *) pdata) + 1);
03494          j++;
03495          break;
03496       case TID_SHORT:
03497          if (j > 7) {
03498             printf("\n%4i-> ", i);
03499             j = 0;
03500             i += 8;
03501          }
03502          if ((dsp_fmt == DSP_DEC) || (dsp_fmt == DSP_UNK))
03503             printf("%5.1i ", *((short *) pdata));
03504          if (dsp_fmt == DSP_HEX)
03505             printf("0x%4.4x ", *((short *) pdata));
03506          pdata = (char *) (((short *) pdata) + 1);
03507          j++;
03508          break;
03509       case TID_BYTE:
03510       case TID_STRUCT:
03511          if (j > 15) {
03512             printf("\n%4i-> ", i);
03513             j = 0;
03514             i += 16;
03515          }
03516          if (dsp_fmt == DSP_DEC)
03517             printf("%4.i ", *((BYTE *) pdata));
03518          if ((dsp_fmt == DSP_HEX) || (dsp_fmt == DSP_UNK))
03519             printf("0x%2.2x ", *((BYTE *) pdata));
03520          pdata++;
03521          j++;
03522          break;
03523       case TID_SBYTE:
03524          if (j > 15) {
03525             printf("\n%4i-> ", i);
03526             j = 0;
03527             i += 16;
03528          }
03529          if ((dsp_fmt == DSP_DEC) || (dsp_fmt == DSP_UNK))
03530             printf("%4.i ", *((BYTE *) pdata));
03531          if (dsp_fmt == DSP_HEX)
03532             printf("0x%2.2x ", *((BYTE *) pdata));
03533          pdata++;
03534          j++;
03535          break;
03536       case TID_BOOL:
03537          if (j > 15) {
03538             printf("\n%4i-> ", i);
03539             j = 0;
03540             i += 16;
03541          }
03542          (*((BOOL *) pdata) != 0) ? printf("Y ") : printf("N ");
03543          pdata = (char *) (((DWORD *) pdata) + 1);
03544          j++;
03545          break;
03546       case TID_CHAR:
03547          if (j > 15) {
03548             printf("\n%4i-> ", i);
03549             j = 0;
03550             i += 16;
03551          }
03552          if (dsp_fmt == DSP_DEC)
03553             printf("%3.i ", *((BYTE *) pdata));
03554          if (dsp_fmt == DSP_ASC || (dsp_fmt == DSP_UNK))
03555             printf("%1.1s ", (char *) pdata);
03556          if (dsp_fmt == DSP_HEX)
03557             printf("0x%2.2x ", *((BYTE *) pdata));
03558          pdata++;
03559          j++;
03560          break;
03561       default:
03562          printf("bank type not supported (%d)\n", type);
03563          return;
03564          break;
03565       }
03566    }                            /* end of bank */
03567    printf("\n");
03568    return;
03569 }
03570 
03571 /*-- GENERAL file fragmentation and recovery -----Section d)--------*/
03572 /*-- GENERAL file fragmentation and recovery -----------------------*/
03573 /*-- GENERAL file fragmentation and recovery -----------------------*/
03574 /*-- GENERAL file fragmentation and recovery -----------------------*/
03575 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03576 INT yb_file_recompose(void *pevt, INT format, char *svpath, INT file_mode)
03577 /********************************************************************\
03578 Routine: external file_recompose
03579 Purpose: Receive event which are expected to be file oriented with
03580 YM_xFILE header.
03581 Input:
03582 char * pevt           pointer to a YBOS event (->LRL).
03583 char * svpath         path where to save file
03584 INT    file_mode      NO_RUN : save file under original name
03585 ADD_RUN: cat run number at end of file name
03586 Output:
03587 none
03588 Function value:
03589 YB_SUCCESS         OP successfull
03590 YB_INCOMPLETE      file compose channels still open
03591 YB_COMPLETE        All file compose channels closed or complete
03592 status             -x error of inner call
03593 \********************************************************************/
03594 {
03595    YM_CFILE *pmyfch;
03596    int slot, status;
03597 
03598    if (file_mode == YB_NO_RECOVER)
03599       return YB_SUCCESS;
03600 
03601    if (format == FORMAT_YBOS) {
03602       if ((status = ybk_locate((DWORD *) pevt, "CFIL", &pmyfch)) <= 0)
03603          return (status);
03604    } else if (format == FORMAT_MIDAS) {
03605       if ((((EVENT_HEADER *) pevt)->event_id == EVENTID_BOR) ||
03606           (((EVENT_HEADER *) pevt)->event_id == EVENTID_EOR) ||
03607           (((EVENT_HEADER *) pevt)->event_id == EVENTID_MESSAGE))
03608          return YB_BANK_NOT_FOUND;
03609 
03610       pevt = (EVENT_HEADER *) pevt + 1;
03611       if ((status = bk_locate(pevt, "CFIL", &pmyfch)) <= 0)
03612          return (status);
03613    }
03614 
03615    printf("%i - %i - %i - %i - %i -%i -%i \n", pmyfch->file_ID,
03616           pmyfch->size, pmyfch->fragment_size, pmyfch->total_fragment,
03617           pmyfch->current_fragment, pmyfch->current_read_byte, pmyfch->run_number);
03618 
03619    /* check if file is in progress */
03620    for (slot = 0; slot < MAX_YM_FILE; slot++) {
03621       if ((ymfile[slot].fHandle != 0)
03622           && (pmyfch->file_ID == ymfile[slot].file_ID)) {
03623          /* Yep file in progress for that file_ID */
03624          if ((status = yb_ymfile_update(slot, format, pevt)) != YB_SUCCESS) {
03625             printf("yb_ymfile_update() failed\n");
03626             return status;
03627          }
03628          goto check;
03629       }
03630       /* next slot */
03631    }
03632    /* current fragment not registered => new file */
03633    /* open file, get slot back */
03634    if ((status = yb_ymfile_open(&slot, format, pevt, svpath, file_mode)) != YB_SUCCESS) {
03635       printf("yb_ymfile_open() failed\n");
03636       return status;
03637    }
03638    /* update file */
03639    if ((status = yb_ymfile_update(slot, format, pevt)) != YB_SUCCESS) {
03640       printf("yb_ymfile_update() failed\n");
03641       return status;
03642    }
03643 
03644  check:
03645    /* for completion of recovery on ALL files */
03646    for (slot = 0; slot < MAX_YM_FILE; slot++) {
03647       if (ymfile[slot].fHandle != 0) {
03648          /* Yes still some file composition in progress */
03649          return YB_INCOMPLETE;
03650       }
03651       /* next slot */
03652    }
03653    return YB_COMPLETE;
03654 }
03655 
03656 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03657 INT yb_ymfile_open(int *slot, int fmt, void *pevt, char *svpath, INT file_mode)
03658 /********************************************************************\
03659 Routine: yb_ymfile_open
03660 Purpose: Prepare channel for receiving event of YM_FILE type.
03661 Input:
03662 void * pevt           pointer to the data portion of the event
03663 char * svpath         path where to save file
03664 INT    file_mode      NO_RUN : save file under original name
03665 ADD_RUN: cat run number at end of file name
03666 Output:
03667 INT  * slot           index of the opened channel
03668 Function value:
03669 YB_SUCCESS          Successful completion
03670 YB_FAIL_OPEN        cannot create output file
03671 YB_NOMORE_SLOT      no more slot for starting dump
03672 \********************************************************************/
03673 {
03674    YM_CFILE *pmyfch;
03675    YM_PFILE *pmyfph;
03676    char *pfilename;
03677    char srun[16], sslot[3];
03678    int i, status;
03679 
03680    /* initialize invalid slot */
03681    *slot = -1;
03682 
03683    if (fmt == FORMAT_YBOS) {
03684       if ((status = ybk_locate((DWORD *) pevt, "CFIL", &pmyfch)) <= 0)
03685          return (status);
03686       if ((status = ybk_locate((DWORD *) pevt, "PFIL", &pmyfph)) <= 0)
03687          return (status);
03688    } else if (fmt == FORMAT_MIDAS) {
03689       if ((status = bk_locate(pevt, "CFIL", &pmyfch)) <= 0)
03690          return (status);
03691       if ((status = bk_locate(pevt, "PFIL", &pmyfph)) <= 0)
03692          return (status);
03693    } else
03694       return -2;
03695    /* find free slot */
03696    for (i = 0; i < MAX_YM_FILE; i++)
03697       if (ymfile[i].fHandle == 0)
03698          break;
03699    if (i < MAX_YM_FILE) {
03700       /* copy necessary file header info */
03701       ymfile[i].file_ID = pmyfch->file_ID;
03702       strcpy(ymfile[i].path, pmyfph->path);
03703 
03704       /* extract file name */
03705       pfilename = pmyfph->path;
03706       if (strrchr(pmyfph->path, '/') > pfilename)
03707          pfilename = strrchr(pmyfph->path, '/');
03708       if (strrchr(pmyfph->path, '\\') > pfilename)
03709          pfilename = strrchr(pmyfph->path, '\\');
03710       if (strrchr(pmyfph->path, ':') > pfilename)
03711          pfilename = strrchr(pmyfph->path, ':');
03712       if (*pfilename != pmyfph->path[0])
03713          pfilename++;
03714 
03715       /* add path name */
03716       if (svpath[0] != 0) {
03717          ymfile[i].path[0] = 0;
03718          strncat(ymfile[i].path, svpath, strlen(svpath));
03719          if (ymfile[i].path[strlen(ymfile[i].path) - 1] != DIR_SEPARATOR)
03720             strcat(ymfile[i].path, DIR_SEPARATOR_STR);
03721          /* append the file name */
03722          strcat(ymfile[i].path, pfilename);
03723       }
03724       if (file_mode == YB_ADD_RUN) {    /* append run number */
03725          strcat(ymfile[i].path, ".");
03726          sprintf(srun, "Run%4.4i", pmyfch->run_number);
03727          strncat(ymfile[i].path, srun, strlen(srun));
03728       }
03729       /* differentiate the possible file dumps 
03730          as the path is unique */
03731       if (i > 0) {
03732          sprintf(sslot, ".%03i", i);
03733          strcat(ymfile[i].path, sslot);
03734       }
03735 
03736       /* open device */
03737       if ((ymfile[i].fHandle =
03738            open(ymfile[i].path, O_WRONLY | O_CREAT | O_TRUNC | O_BINARY | O_LARGEFILE, 0644)) == -1) {
03739          ymfile[i].fHandle = 0;
03740          printf("File %s cannot be created\n", ymfile[i].path);
03741          return (SS_FILE_ERROR);
03742       }
03743    } else {
03744       /* no more slot */
03745       printf("No more slot for file %s\n", pmyfph->path);
03746       return YB_NOMORE_SLOT;
03747    }
03748 
03749    ymfile[i].current_read_byte = 0;
03750    ymfile[i].current_fragment = 0;
03751    *slot = i;
03752    return YB_SUCCESS;
03753 }
03754 
03755 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03756 INT yb_ymfile_update(int slot, int fmt, void *pevt)
03757 /********************************************************************\
03758 Routine: yb_ymfile_update
03759 Purpose: dump Midas/Ybos event to file for YBOS file oriented event type.
03760 Input:
03761 char * pevt           pointer to the data portion of the event.
03762 Output:
03763 INT  slot             valid index of the opened channel.
03764 Function value:
03765 YB_SUCCESS         Successful completion
03766 -1                     error
03767 \********************************************************************/
03768 {
03769    YM_CFILE *pmyfch;
03770    char *pmyfd;
03771    int status;
03772    int nwrite;
03773 
03774    if (fmt == FORMAT_YBOS) {
03775       if ((status = ybk_locate((DWORD *) pevt, "CFIL", &pmyfch)) <= 0)
03776          return (status);
03777       if ((status = ybk_locate((DWORD *) pevt, "DFIL", &pmyfd)) <= 0)
03778          return (status);
03779 
03780       /* check sequence order */
03781       if (ymfile[slot].current_fragment + 1 != pmyfch->current_fragment) {
03782          printf("Out of sequence %i / %i\n", ymfile[slot].current_fragment,
03783                 pmyfch->current_fragment);
03784       }
03785       /* dump fragment to file */
03786       nwrite = write(ymfile[slot].fHandle, pmyfd, pmyfch->fragment_size);
03787 
03788       /* update current file record */
03789       ymfile[slot].current_read_byte += nwrite;
03790       ymfile[slot].current_fragment++;
03791       /* check if file has to be closed */
03792       if (ymfile[slot].current_fragment == pmyfch->total_fragment) {
03793          /* file complete */
03794          close(ymfile[slot].fHandle);
03795          printf("File %s (%i) completed\n", ymfile[slot].path,
03796                 ymfile[slot].current_read_byte);
03797          /* cleanup slot */
03798          ymfile[slot].fHandle = 0;
03799          return YB_SUCCESS;
03800       } /* close file */
03801       else {
03802          /* fragment retrieved wait next one */
03803          return YB_SUCCESS;
03804       }
03805    } else if (fmt == FORMAT_MIDAS) {
03806       if ((status = bk_locate(pevt, "CFIL", &pmyfch)) <= 0)
03807          return (status);
03808       if ((status = bk_locate(pevt, "DFIL", &pmyfd)) <= 0)
03809          return (status);
03810 
03811       /* check sequence order */
03812       if (ymfile[slot].current_fragment + 1 != pmyfch->current_fragment) {
03813          printf("Out of sequence %i / %i\n", ymfile[slot].current_fragment,
03814                 pmyfch->current_fragment);
03815       }
03816       /* dump fragment to file */
03817       nwrite = write(ymfile[slot].fHandle, pmyfd, pmyfch->fragment_size);
03818 
03819       /* update current file record */
03820       ymfile[slot].current_read_byte += nwrite;
03821       ymfile[slot].current_fragment++;
03822       /* check if file has to be closed */
03823       if (ymfile[slot].current_fragment == pmyfch->total_fragment) {
03824          /* file complete */
03825          close(ymfile[slot].fHandle);
03826          printf("File %s (%i) completed\n", ymfile[slot].path,
03827                 ymfile[slot].current_read_byte);
03828          /* cleanup slot */
03829          ymfile[slot].fHandle = 0;
03830          return YB_SUCCESS;
03831       } /* close file */
03832       else {
03833          /* fragment retrieved wait next one */
03834          return YB_SUCCESS;
03835       }
03836    } else
03837       return YB_UNKNOWN_FORMAT;
03838 }
03839 #endif                          /* OS_VXWORKS Frontend */
